Wow! That was the first word that I said after finishing this movie. Director Gavin O'Connor did a great job with these group of actors and allowing the audience to get absorbed in the story. I'm not a MMA fan, but I loved this movie. This movie was more than a MMA movie. It was a movie about hardships, determination, pain, and triumph."Warrior" deals with the story of two brothers who don't really know each other. An alcoholic father, Paddy Conlon (Nick Nolte) who doesn't know his sons anymore due to his alcoholism. Two brothers with totally different lives that both need a fighting competition to get their lives back on track. I thought younger brother Tommy (Tom Hardy) performance was really great. I can't wait to see Tom Hardy in the "The Dark Knight Rises." He was believable, real, and a very powerful character. The older brother Brendan (Joel Edgerton) also had an amazing performance. I was pulling for him the entire movie. And Nick Nolte was the perfect person for his role as an recovering alcoholic. And the remaining supporting cast also made for a real authentic experience.This movie was probably the best fighting movie I've seen in a really long time, if not ever. It was great because it was authentic and genuine. It was emotional and heart felt. It had everything a good fighting movie needed. It was a great culmination of directing, acting, film making, and music. I highly recommend it. You will want to get in the cage yourself after watching it.

Review title: Best Action movie of 2011, and something to be seen again and again
Review_body: Warrior is Gavin O' Connor's best movie to date, and certainly one of the best action movies of all times. Beyond the top-notch, and quite realistic action sequences, the movie--as the t-shirt of Brendan Conlon's trainer Frank shows--has the 'soul of a lion'. The backdrop of an MMA championship remains so, in the backdrop, with the key element of drama remaining the tension and struggles of a broken family, consisting of a ex-alcoholic war-veteran father, an elder son who teaches school Physics, and the younger son who suffers from PTSD from the war in Iraq.Forgiveness comes hard when the wounds are too deep, when the man to forgive was responsible for the premature and miserable death of your mother, and when the elder brother stood you up when you tried to run away from the abusive father. Tommy Conlon finds refuge in the marine corps, only to see his best buddy die from friendly fire. He goes AWOL, takes his mother's name, and surfaces back in the States. His father Paddy is the best trainer he's had, the main responsible for making him a child prodigy in wrestling, and despite the loathing, he knows that's the way to go if he's to get the money to support his dead buddy's family.Brendan Conlon the elder brother has always resented his father's preference for his younger brother, the better fighter. Now a schoolteacher, with a delayed and oppressive loan, he knows the three jobs between his wife and him are not sufficient to retain their house, and tries his hand at MMA, harking back to his past stint at the UFC, where his performance was nothing to write home about. He knows the prize money is the way out of a potential bankruptcy, and knows the choices are difficult, but limited.Paddy Conlon the war veteran has been off the bottle for a thousand days and seeks redemption in the church, and Herman Melville's Moby Dick. Try as he might to get closer to either son, the two sons have only thing in common as Tommy puts it sometime late in the movie--they both have absolutely no use for their ex-alcoholic wife-beating father. He tries nevertheless, taking abuse and ridicule in his stride, since he knows forgiveness is the only way out of his past sins. Nick Nolte's role is understated and so realistic it defies comprehension. For that matter, both the protagonists are so good I kept expecting to see either one of them being actual MMA fighters (having not recalled either of their earlier movies). The fights between them are realistic, and hold your attention without being tacky.The climax is sure-fire tear-jerker with the two brothers fighting out each other, but more than that their own demons. One gets to see that blood is indeed thicker than water, but without the message being drilled into place.Worth seeing again and again. 10/10.

I saw the trailer for this and immediately thought that this was a Rocky for 2011. To a certain extent this is true as everything builds up to the main event - a $5 million cage fight for the toughest fighters around the globe - and it is the story of 2 underdogs both of whom happen to be estranged brothers. Brought up in and then split by a harsh, patriarchal family, the 2 brothers follow their own separate paths - one a physics teacher and family man, the other a troubled marine.Both Edgerton (Brendan Conlan) and Hardy (Tommy Conlan) play their respective parts well but it is Edgerton who gets more screen time and is the more likable character - a struggling teacher who needs to fight to pay his mortgage and keep a roof over his family's heads. Hardy doesn't get to flex the acting muscles too much as we only get to see him do angry or angrier. He is angry about his past and angry about his present. He does however play the pit-bull pugilist to a tee with his fight scenes in the cage being the most brutal. Nolte plays the rather pathetic, recovering alcoholic dad competently but I found a few of his scenes slightly forced as this character was too sketchily drawn for the viewer to become emotionally involved. Brendan' wife, Jennifer Morrison, is no Adrian Balboa as her character is given little scope to express anything more than mild worry about her husband's decision to return to fighting as a career.I enjoyed this film immensely but I personally don't think that it's the Oscar material as some are touting. Warrior is hugely watchable but for me, this is not in the same league as the Fighter or Rocky. Both of those films provide us much more in terms of character development, back story and in the Fighter's case far superior dialogue. It is, however, a fantastic Friday night fight film that will entertain and excite in great measure.

After seeing this movie, I had a hard time explaining why I like it so much. I don't like predictable movies, especially sports ones. I don't like movies that are full of cliché. Warrior is a sports movie that revels in the cliché. But I LOVED it.There are a few different reasons this movie stands out. First of all, the acting is ridiculously good. The two leads, Tom Hardy and Joel Edgerton, were convincing not only as MMA fighters, but as three- dimensional human beings. And Nick Nolte is great as the brothers' newly sober father. Second, instead of being a sports movie, it's a good movie with a sport in it. If you went into this movie without knowing anything about it, you wouldn't realize it was a fight movie until about half an hour in. It builds up the characters perfectly, so that when they fight, the viewer is completely invested in them.And when the movie finally reaches the big tournament at the end, the fights are awesome. It actually kind of shows the different styles going into MMA, where one brother is just a giant physical force, while the other is more about technique. The scenes were a little too heavily edited for my taste, but I could ignore it because I was invested in the outcomes of the fights.I honestly can't think of many people that wouldn't like this movie. It didn't do too great at the box office, but hopefully word-of-mouth will get more people to see it this weekend.

Review title: Cheesy & corny, but proves a huge point
Review_body: Men also need romantic pop corn flicks like The Notebook or Twilight. That has been proved with Warrior. I've read and heard that a lot of guys have been saying how Warrior made them cry, how emotional it was. I get it.But this movie doesn't deserve 8/10 and i think it has 8/10 because most guys rated before wiping their eyes.Warrior brings out the big guns. Every cliché you've seen is used here. Almost every line is cheesy. Did you enjoy seeing how the teacher beats up the undefeated Russian world champion, knowing it could never happen in real life? If you did, you got clicheed good.Did you like the ever so cheesy scenes with the kids routing in the parking lot & the principal routing in his living room? Cheesy.Nolte was brilliant, but this movie isn't and the ratings will probably drop once people re watch it with dry eyes.5/10, for Noltes performance, and because i enjoy fantasy. After all, it's a movie about the biggest tournament in the world where the best fighters from all over the planet fight, and the 2 finalists is a teacher who has been working out for 1 month and one ex soldier who hasn't fought since he was 10. (And the TEACHER WINS, LOL!)

Review title: Warrior: better than The Fighter in my opinion...
Review_body: I was blown away when i saw this film. It was very unexpected. With a theme like this (Sport Fighting films, I thought this film would be terrible like the film "Never Back Down" which was mediocre. But With great performances by Edgerton, Hardy and Nolte, this film worked very well.Tom Hardy was very dark and mysterious and some his scenes were very powerful, same with Nick Nolte when he was drunk and aggressive. Joel Edgerton were very good too. Although the first half of the film was bit boring, it got very interesting when it came to the fight scenes, it was very intense and very entertaining, the ending was very emotional when the two brothers had to fight each other. I thought this was better than The Fighter there were three great performances, loads of entertaining fight scenes and the family drama between the characters, the script was very well written. I recommend you to watch this in the cinema for that surround sound that will give you goosebumps when watching the fight scenes...

Review title: Nick Nolte Deserves an Oscar Nom
Review_body: On the surface, Warrior is about MMA and UFC fighting, but this takes a back seat to the gritty emotion of the relationship between father-son and brother-brother (Tom Hardy and Joel Edgerton). As back story, we have a family that has crumbled at the hands of an alcoholic father (Nick Nolte), who nowadays is mature and sober (and listens to Moby Dick on audio book). Joel Edgerton may have a more enticing story playing the older brother who gets suspended from his normal science teacher job for fighting MMA, but the hardcore way Tom Hardy portrays an ex-Marine beast is undeniable. You will most definitely root against him, but the stronger your hatred towards Hardy, the more you have to applaud his amazing performance. Of course, Nick Nolte takes the cake. In a scene that reads "Oscar Nom" all over it, the type of scene that Oscar people salivate over, we find the mature, 1,000 days sober father in a hotel room drowning his sorrows. With empty bottles strewn across the floor, Moby Dick piping through the headphones, Nolte is drunk as a sailor shouting, "Ahab! You stop the ship! Ahab! Stop the Ship!"

Review title: best fighting movie i've ever seen
Review_body: I'm just going to put spoiler just to be safe because I hate it when anything is given away in movies..I'm just going to start off this review with the best part of the movie and the acting was pretty damn good. The music.Whoever did the music for this movie is a true genius. My face was completely glued to the TV screen and the music just made my heart beat much faster. Especially during the tournament, every fight that the brothers were in felt as if they were saving the world. My body was shaking because of that movie and I felt so compelled to the screen. BUT, the music isn't the only thing. I think the father and Tommy were played by the perfect actors. Especially the father. His emotions and when he gets drunk again is impressively done. Honestly I wouldn't be surprised if he wasn't acting, they just caught him while he was hammered. Tommy to me felt as if 'nothing matters anymore.' And he played that damn well. When they find out who he really is, he acts calm and not surprised. I can't say much bad about this movie only that i want 6 more of them to be made.

There was a time when Tom Hardy wasn't that famous. I know right, I can't even imagine anymore, but it's true. At the turn of the last century, he had a starring turn in Bronson to his name & a brief role in Rock'N'Rolla before the mightly Christopher Nolan cast him in one of the lead roles in his epic, sprawling masterpiece Inception.He then went on a run of excellent performances including Locke, Tinker, Tailor, Soldier, Spy, Lawless and of course The Dark Knight Rises and in amongst those was Warrior.The story of a broken home and sibling love/rivalry/respect with that magical mix of emotion and battle that most combat sports films don't manage to hit. By the time you get to the final fight, you really are at the edge of your seat and it's exhausting.Amongst my circles, this is at cult-levels of hype.

This is the first movie I have ever given a rating this high, the reason being the researchers obviously did their job very well as one of the characters is obviously suffering from PTSD. This is an illness I suffer from myself and could so relate to why he was like he is, It was shocking how realistic it made that character seem to me, and I have never experienced that emotion from any film I have ever watched. Putting all that aside this is a proper heartfelt sport/action/drama movie anyway and is well worth a watch, and will leave you feeling glad you gave up the time to do so. I started watching this movie with low expectations, as i wrongly assumed it would be another story-less waste of an hour and a half or more of my life, but was shocked and surprised how good it is. Watch it you will not regret it.

Watch The Similar Movie Called: Brothers (2015)
This an almost the same
Very Good action cage fighting movie. Nice one

Thought it was a good film. The story was good, and the acting was great - Tom Hardy's great in everything. But this film was ruined by turning a fighting film into a soppy film where the underdog comes out on top, even though Tommy was the better fighter. Thought the ending was crap.
Absolutely rubbish. Such a boring movie. When you watch a fighting movie, you don't expect to wait 1 hour before seeing the fighting part. Absolute waste of time.
Great acting, but I'm not recommending it for any MMA fan.

When you have to constantly lower the volume, and then raise the volume then the whole movie experience is ruined. It makes no sense how loud the background noise gets and how loud the music gets compared to the voices. And then some voices are extra low volume. Please fire whoever was supposed to make this movie a unified experience.

This movie is a joke and I love a good drama/action movie. So many cornet moments, to many to count. Every single fight scene is unrealistic. The main actor gets punched and kneed in the head over 50 times in one night and does not get knocked out. One man took a beating that no man could take and did not have a bruise or any blood to show for it. This is a laughable mma movie so far from anything realistic. Basically backyard brawling punching eachother wildly and with no referee. The only saving grace with Tom hardy acting. This movie is trash

In short: This movie is not about fighting, it's about life, about values, about priorities it set's them right.
In Longer version: amazing movie, that gets you caught cheering in a movie, like in real sport, amazing sound track absolutely blasts. Maybe not too realistic, but hey its a movie and a great one.

This is the typical fight film formula, the underdog fighter comes from the bottom of the heap to make it big. Other reviewers have compared it favorably to two other famous fight films, Rocky and Million Dollar Baby. Those movies had exciting fights, involvement in the characters, and entertaining plots. Unfortunately Warrior has none of these. Most of the fights are really short, usually lasting a few seconds and the climactic fight is not real exciting (but not bad). I couldn't really get too involved with the characters and in fact could care less about them. There's not that much of a plot line and what there is is not that involving.I'm not saying that this movie is a total zero, it's just not that great. If you want to see better fight movies then rent Rocky or Million Dollar Baby.I am aware that many others are giving much more positive reviews of this movie than I am giving it. Rarely do I differ that much with the reviews that others give. I can only describe things as I see them. I can not see how people could leave the theater crying unless it is from being upset after having paid money to see this.

Review title: Wow..what is up with these high ratings
Review_body: This was a very slow ...horrible movie! I usually don't write reviews but after reading the reviews of how great this movie was ...I had to make sure I was watching the same movie!! Did all the directors best friends post reviews!!! "Better than Rocky". C'mon....this is ridiculous

Review title: Epic movie with great acting performances
Review_body: Everything about this movie is truly amazing. Some of the best acting performances I've ever seen. If you haven't seen this yet, watch it immediately!

I saw this movie yesterday. The movie is good. But, the story is nothing really new, too much unnecessary drama, clichés make this a 7/10 and nowhere close to 8. I also hated the fact that a not-so-good-and- experienced fighter with a little training and heart wins over much better fighters, not once but just way too many times. And that too, after taking a pounding every single time. I understand that he is one of the main characters but, come on!. When I watch movies such as this, I expect it to be a realistic but this one pushes some things way too far.Still a good movie but don't see the IMDb rating and think this is one of the best. Its not.

Review title: I had high hopes for this...
Review_body: I am very disappointed in this and the reason is I thought it was gonna be a masterpiece. Honestly for the life of me I can not fathom how people liked this movie. Fault? the STORY! My main criticism is that the film is littered with any possible cliché you can imagine and then some, and for me it ruins the movie. The story is dragging and dragging the main characters compete one against each other for whom of the 3 lives the biggest tragedy when -think of it for a second- if they put aside their differences every one's problem will automatically get sorted out. On the positive side the fighting scenes are among the best as is the cast, and I also enjoyed the soundtrack.Long story short, this isn't a bad movie by any measure it is just so unoriginal. The Fighter, Rocky, Cinderella man, Raging bull. Every single plot twist and every character can be found among them. A nearly wasted Saturday night. Overall 5/10

This movie was a great piece. The story was well written and you truly feel sucked in the whole film.I felt I must post that the ending did in fact throw me off a bit as I knew who would win between the brothers. There are far too many unanswered questions that left me befuddled.Did the widow receive any of the winnings, from which brother? - Was patty going to be ever to meet his grandchildren? - Did Tommy get brought right to the marines after his brother helped walk there, prison time!?The better outcome would have been seeing tommy and Brendan battle it out with Tommy coming out on top. One could say well, Brendan was always the underdog, who cares..... Brendan had already beat the unexpected and it was time for him to find his place as the inferior fighter in comparison to younger Tommy. Tommy, the brother that didn't bail on his mother at her worst times and was fighting to help 100% for his dead friends wife. If Tommy would have won, he could have hugged it out in similar fashion as the ending, but rather told Brendan he loved him and given him enough of the earnings to stay afloat plus some. Then Tommy could have given the rest up and walked with his head high into the clunker. I would have much rather preferred this ending.Thanks,

Review title: One of the best sport movies of all time.
Review_body: If i could give this a 8.5 i would When i first saw the preview for this movie, i was a little skeptical. I thought it was going to be like The Fighter, with just less talented actors. To a point i was right, none of the performances in this are as good as Christian Bales, but that being said, everyone did a great job in this movie. Nick Nolte gave a marvelous performance that should be worthy of a Best supporting actor nom. The previews let you know the gist of the story, two brothers enter a MMA tournament where they eventually face off. Even though they are brothers they are very different in character and the way they were raised, the only thing in common being their dislike for their father. The movie shows their current and past life struggles to get them to where they are in the movie and it all leads up to awesome finale. This movie does for MMA what Vision Quest did for wrestling, i just hope this gets a better following.

This movie is what Hollywood is about. Pure, emotional, bestial , true and... simple. A real introspection in what winning is and is not. But... They chose the wrong winner (And it's what we like or not). The bestial brother needed to win over his fellow 'smart' family member. Just a little lack of daring on a story basis from a Hollywoodian perspective. But it's really all we can reproach to this piece of art. I cannot not think of the The Wrestler and the not yet disfigured Mickey Rourke (of 9 1/2 weeks) when I see the lost soul in this movie who grew up with the mother and left the army shamefully. Just a bit too American maybe... just maybe... The realization is sensational. At the end of the movie we really feel like getting out of reality. This movie was the best that UFC could expect. In 'Warrior' We are deep in the Greek empire as noticed by the father of our two heroes somewhere in the begging. This movie is an epic journey. Who know, maybe in two thousand years mythology will be about watching such movies... I can hardly grasp how awesome it will be to study history in 2000 years.

Review title: brilliant work,excellent story and perfect match for the genre..
Review_body: i was waiting for Warrior release for so long and just now i watched. it was so amazing and interesting movie,keeps u entertaining and stick to chair to continue watching without blinking an eye. really i mean these words,it was really a nice movie,the best things were,it had no nudity,no obscene words or anything which has to be skipped while watching with the family, nice soundtracks, a perfectly going story and awesome acting. for my this movie is a masterpiece and one of the best movies i have seen so far. a family action and drama movie. i would recommend everyone to watch and enjoy.thumbs up for Warrior.i would appreciate if there were more like this kind. 10 of 10.

Jesus Christ. Where to begin. Easily the best film I've seen all year, and I've watched Drive.I was literally on the edge of my seat from start to finish, phenomenal acting from the entire cast made this such a joy to watch. I've seen Never Back Down, which had one good feature; the gorgeous Amber Heard, and that was a shambles of a film about mma. To say this is the Rocky of mma films is an understatement. Stallone cannot touch Hardy or Edgerton in their acting prowess. This is easily the definitive sports film. Every bout, every fight between family members was breathtaking. The only sports movie to come close in terms of sheer brilliance is Coach Carter. When you watch this film you will cheer for both sides, both fighting for just causes and neither for themselves.

Review title: If you haven't seen warrior, you have seen nothing
Review_body: Movie starts like an average story, a guy (Joel)facing financial problems and having bad times with him filling up mortgage loan. And on a parallel, an ex-marine (Tom Hardy) shows up at his father's home drinking. He wants to fight in championship and want his father to be his trainer. Joel goes to a bar fight leading him into detention for one semester from his teaching career. He has no other option, other than fighting championship. In the meanwhile Tom is messing up with his dad because they had family issues all their life. And it turns out Joel and Tom are brothers for real. Championship starts, both Joel and Tom make their ways to final. But final is the real climax. Real brothers have to fight each other to win championship title. Last fight is the reality of life, you have to take some actions sometimes you really don't wanna do. Fighting real brother, that will burst you into tears. Just feel it, just feel how hard is to beet your brother.

Review title: Sort your family problems but not in an MMA final
Review_body: I did not have many expectations before seeing this movie and also didn't read the description of the movie. The plot was at many times pretty obvious and many viewers anticipated from the start of the movie that the two brothers will settle family business in this unrealistic MMA final. I won't criticize the fantasy of two underdogs fighting an MMA final, but instead I want to emphasize on the idea of a broken family: on one side was the rebellious Tommy who was blaming everyone around him for his mother's death, while on the other side, Brendan the retired UFC average fighter who picked up a teaching position choosing lower paid but secure employment as a physics teacher, fighting for the biggest motive, not fame, girls or belts, but his family's salvation from bankruptcy. Also the Pop (Nick Nolte) did a great job as the estranged father fighting alcoholism who in the end sees his two boys reunite in an applause filled movie happy ending. At the end I could say, Brendan tamed his furious brother and took up his big brother role again, while Tommy finally could be happy with himself, although losing this match. Actually, I had a feeling (maybe I'm wrong) that Tommy wanted to lose and let the guilt consume him as he never felt being a part of his family. I gave it a 7.5/10, due to the plot and the pretty grandiose happy ending who were obvious at all times. All in all, a good movie about fighting, personal & family dramas and underdogs winning MMA championships. It's worth watching, you won't be disappointed. In case you haven't seen it yet, don't miss it: The Wrestler with Mickey Rourke.

When it comes to sports movies, fighting movie specifically, there is less leeway when it comes to keeping the viewers attention. Sports in general are entertaining so the sports movies must be too. And Warrior is insanely entertaining. the MMA shots are done incredibly well and you almost feel like you are watching a real MMA fight.On top of that we get a sports movie that gets you emotionally attached. You really feel for the two brothers and even the father for what they all had to go through in their lives that led them to this point. You even feel for the dead-beat dad who was able to turn in life around and you find yourself hoping he would be able to fix things up with his two kids.The final fight sequence leaves you with your jaw open not knowing who to root for. Yes, some aspects of the plot are ridiculous but you quickly get past it as the movie continues. This 2 hour 20 minute movie feels like an hour and a half.98/100.

You don't have to be a fight or MMA fan to love this movie. The amount of emotion this movie has is pristine, amazing and subtle performances from Tom Hardy and Joel Edgerton. overall perfect picture 10/10.

If you grew up with siblings and understand how deep the love of your brother or sister is than you'll love this movie! Like Rocky this is not just an underdog fight movie but a love story. Except this is about the love of two brothers and how in the end that blood runs deeper than all else! Hardy gives one his earliest best performances that you have seen since then in Mad Max, Dark Knight and Dunkirk. He is amazing with his stoic dark expressions and you can read his pain and torment without him saying a word. Edgerton and Nolte give strong performances that tells how even through deep dysfunction family love conquers in the end. The fight scenes are real and gritty filmed amazingly up close so you feel like your in the ring. The triumph is in the story and the characters that you feel for and are jumping out of your seat for as you root for them to conquer their openents which are hate, fear, and self worth. This movie does not feel like it's 2.5 hour running time as similar films of the same length. Well worth the watch and will leave you feeling exhilarated.

This movie is fantastic. It is gripping from start to finish. The first half builds on the characters and their relationships with one another in a way that makes you genuinely care about them despite their flaws. The second half is a brilliant well shot action packed fighting film. All performances in this film are outstanding. I had a tear in my eye at the end. Every scene is well acted and the fighting scenes are realistic and superbly performed. I would recommend this film to anyone, not just action or Tom hardy fans! There is a good story line and is not just about gratuitous violence. The fight scenes are gritty but not too bloody for the faint hearted! A must see for any keen movie watcher !

Review title: I can't believe what I've just witnessed......
Review_body: .....the best movie I've seen in YEARS. I'm shocked. I've always loved MMA, watched so many PPV events I could probably pay a mortgage so I expected a sappy, yet enjoyable sports film. Oh my.....was I ever wrong! Tom Hardy....you've blown my mind. But it's not just him, everyone in this film is so believable, I forgot I was watching a movie. I laughed, smiled, chuckled, frowned, held my breath (alot), literally jumped off the couch yelling stuff, held my breath some more, and felt tears well up in my eyes. And that was before the ending!!! The ending is epic, in my opinion. I've read other reviews stating an opinion that it would have been better if certain things happened but I don't agree. I refuse to put spoilers in here but the ending is perfect just the way it is. It's more like watching reality TV the way it's done and like I've already said, I totally forgot I was watching a movie, it's so believable. Please, females who read this......do NOT pass this up because it looks like a guy film. This is like a chick flick wrapped in testosterone. Besides, the stars are gorgeous. This is definitely going in my Blu Ray collection and I'm inviting everyone I know to come over and watch it.

Directing 8/10- Solid directing, intriguing shots and well paced. The fight scenes were phenomenally choreographed. Acting 9.5/10- Some of the acting from the extreme minor roles was cheesy but nick nolte, edgerton and hardy gave amazing heartfelt performances. It's sad to see that nolte, in particular, is not getting more recognition for his performance, his performance was riveting. Screenplay 8/10- The screenplay was rather cliché and predictable. However, I have yet to see another sports film a better and deeper character story line. I have also yet to see a mixed martial arts film this deep and heartfelt. So it's original in those aspects. Visual Effects 7/10- Nothing crazy at all visually, but its not needed with a film like this. The fight scenes were filmed with near perfection. Sound Effects/Music 9/10- The music throughout was solid, but what really lifted the film was the ending song. It tied the scene together in such a beautiful fashion. Overall, great film that might sadly be overlooked. Amazing storyline between the characters and definitely one of the best sports films of all time.

I honestly do not understand how this movie could pass me by almost unnoticed, until I followed a recommendation from a friend.This is the best fight movie I have ever seen. Period.It's the whole package: 3 incredible male leads - Joel Edgerton, Tom Hardy and Nick Nolte, and each of them in the role of their lives. And boy have they trained up for this one. It might not stand closer scrutiny from MMA experts, but it sure captures the UFC atmosphere of such an event, and the way these guys are going at it looks nothing but real.But in the end it's the story line that brings it home. It is so absolutely gripping and emotional, I was balling my eyes out when the credits rolled across the screen. If you're missing this movie, then you cannot be helped.

Fairy tale story, good maybe for kids and American wrestling fans, but making a mockery of the UFC. The main characters are played by known actors who are doing a good job themselves, but the story is simply ridiculous. This could have been a great movie if they didn't exaggerate so much the main characters' backgrounds and kept the narrative at a potentially believable level. What a missed opportunity!

Review title: What a movie ignore the title it's deceiving and the fact it has MMA in this movie is so much more
Review_body: I remember when this movie came out and I didn't bother with it as it sounded like a action MMA testeroned filled hour plus I didn't want to waste. If that's your kind of movie you won't like this, but if you like films like Rocky, the fighter, films that martial arts are apart of the main theme. You will love this.Nick Nolte has always been one of my favourite actors, and Joel Edgerton, Tom Hardy also hasn't disappointed in anything I've seen him in. The title doesn't do this film justice tbh it's why I passed it by previously it's sounds lame asf. Ignore the title and the MMA theme it's about family and the struggles that are contained within throw in life's upside downs and the sometimes unfortunate places We find ourselves and people it molds is into, and how our past and present can make us desperate for connection but also makes us avoid and destroy it.I enjoyed this film I can relate to a lot of the struggles the characters were going through, it's a hidden gem. It's deserves a place on the self with the before mentioned great movies. It's not an action flick or about being a warrior but about being human and fighting the human condition

Review title: "If you don't knock him out , you don't have a home"
Review_body: 10/10 , most underrated movie, portrays the struggles of a broken family , joined together by violence in order to bring peace and forgiveness

A very poor year in the movie industry overall, but this one shines through! A very good drama film, which fails to draw major attention, because of it's theme. Just like "The Wrestler", this movie has a specific idea behind it and a delicate theme (Mixed Martial Arts). Movie critics and people who like meaningful films maybe have overlooked Warrior, exactly because of it's subject, which isn't very popular in this business.Good sports movies have always drawn huge attention and have won numberous awards, but the so called "dirty sports" like Pro wrestling and MMA have received mixed feelings, when taken as a theme for a film... better yet a serious film! Nobody takes in consideration the fact, that in this line of work there are many significant and complex human beings that would become brilliant subjects for a movie character, like for example Tommy Conlon (Tom Hardy) a suffering soul that wonders alone, wanting someone to reach out and pull him away from the darkness. Tommy lives his life in the past, a dark past which is buried deep inside him and so he communicates most of the time by primitive ways like violence and rejection. Rejection towards his father, a former boxer and a drunk Paddy Conlon (Nolte) who has destroyed the family and now wants a forgiveness for his actions, his brother Brendan Conlon (Edgerton) and everyone around, who tries to reach out to him. Brendan Conlon's (Edgerton) role is this of the tipical underdog, who had been underestimated his whole life by his father, brother, mother and friends. His responsibility towards his new family (his wife and two daughters) is the only pure, intact relationship in his life, which he wants to preserve by any means necessary, making him a very dangerous man when pushed to the wall!A great script in my opinion, great story about a dysfunctional family that comes together by the only thing that had brought them close in the past... fighting! Don't miss Warrior, it's one of the year's best!

Review title: Impossible to believe the Ending IMHO.
Review_body: Before people comment "it's just a movie" listen to my point. What ruined the movie for me is the fact that each fighter in the Championship fight, Tommy and Brenden Conlon, each had three fights prior to the Championship. Tommy never had a fight past 30 seconds never mind going into the second round, Brenden on the other hand goes to the third round and gets pummeled in almost every fight prior to the one against Tommy. Brenden would barely be able to stand let alone win, the Russian literally suplexed Brenden twice, yes WWE style. Other than the ending it was a great film, I just cant get over Tommy losing that fight, it's just not possible, even on film, but what was very realistic were all the gay Marine tribal tattoos Tommy had on his arms.

I am not a huge MMA fan, so I didn't know what I was getting into when I decided to watch Warrior (2011) I was pleasantly surprised to see such an entertaining story that really had heart to it. It is about two brothers who leave each other's life very early on. The result is a very tensioned relationship that lasted into their adulthood. The two brothers both end up in a competition together which pits them against each other (a little clichéd, yes) The fight scenes are very well done with enthusiastic commentary by Bryan Callen and Sam Sheridan that really kept the pace quick. Joel Edgerton does a fine job as the more straight-edged chemistry teacher brother but Tom Hardy really steals the show as Tommy, the more disturbed (ex- Marine) and troubled brother of the too. Hardy certainly has the "crazed" look down as it shows up many times during the film much to my amusement. Nolte is great also as the father although I would've liked to see more of a conclusion between him and his sons (although maybe it was better off this way...) The story isn't without it's flaws. The school children who set up a drive-thru theater to watch their chemistry teacher battle it out was a little cringe-worthy. The kids were just a little over-exaggerated with their "Go Mr. C!" signs and their over-sized golf shirts and high-fiving and hollering every time they are shown. The story is obviously ridiculously unrealistic for a couple different reasons but I think the film is not going for realism but trying to tell a heart-felt story. And with that I think they succeeded.
I'm speechless!!! Just watch it!!!! You wont forget it!

i was lucky to not have seen the trailer, nor even known what this movie, 'warrior' is about. not knowing whether the movie was going to be action, as the name might suggest, i was impressed by the great editing and solid storytelling which made me oblivious to the length of it.this movie kept me engaged from the very beginning to the very end. i will recommend this and i look forward to watching it many more times.by far my favorite of this genre.since IMDb mandates ten lines minimum in order to submit a review, i'd like to add that this movie and all its three main characters deserved an Oscar nomination, - nick nolte was the only who was nominated. also the editing deserved one imo.

Review title: A true diamond in a sea of garbage.
Review_body: Warrior is the most heart-melting movie I've seen in a while. Movies of 2011 have been all the same, and much of a disappointment, if I may say so. But this one is different. The story of two troubled siblings, each fighting for it's own just cause, whilst avoiding the ghosts of the past. Their worlds will rumble as they will have to face each other, their father and their most well-kept secrets in a fight that will decide the life of the one or the redemption of the other. With every fight won, I cried tears of joy, with every punch taken, I feared for the brothers. This movie is so touching, even though it dwells in the primal sport of the MMA. A true masterpiece, probably the best that 2011 has given us so far.

Firstly I need to clarify that I do understand the gravity of the statement I've just made and yes Im ready to stick my neck out and say this is the best fight movie ever made! The perennial problem with fight movies is that it has always only appealed to the sex blessed with testosterone and only a handful of movies have managed to transcend the barrier. Rocky, Wrestler, Fighter and Fight Club being the ones I can recall from the top of my head.Now lets quickly come to the reasons why Warrior is a must watch1) The acting is top notch! Nicky Nolte gives a touching performance! He is the absolute standout performer playing the role of a drunk father who is repenting and trying his best to make amends, closely followed by Tom Hardy (the reason why I actually watched this movie) playing the role of an ex army man who seems to be full of hatred and is waiting to explode in the ring. Joel Edgerton does a good job too as a father looking to make ends meet and does justice to his role.2) The screenplay of this movie is fantastic! Gavin O' Connor deserves full credit for this! Also unlike regular fight movies where you really know whos going to win in the end, this movie will keep you on the edge of your seats till the very end!3) Warrior might be a fight movie but only about 1/3rd of it is devoted to actual MMA fighting. The rest of the story defines the characters really well. Also even though it times in at 2 hours 20 minutes it doesn't seem stretched and on the contrary you actually wish the movie was longer.4) It evokes all sorts of emotions from you! And very few movies can actually do that.5) Fight movies have evolved over time and have come a long way from being just eye catching, physics defying Bruce Lee or Jackie Chan starrers to soul touching and motivating movies like Wrestler and Fighter. Warrior in a way summarizes all these aspects and is a beautiful concoction of great fight stunts and emotions.I give it a 9/10...a MUST WATCH!

Review title: Best martial arts movie/sports drama ever seen
Review_body: This is one of the best movies I've seen past few years. Storyline, acting, visual images, fighting scenes, everything is just perfect. Usually, when I see a movie get awesome, over the top critics, mostly it ends up being pretentious crap. But not this one, this is a really entertaining movie and is a must see this year. It is great cinema, but also a quality movie. The only thing I'm really wondering about is, why the heck did they have to put in the Russian guy?? Come on, wasn't that a bit obvious and unnecessary? It just reminded me; yep, still a commercial Hollywood movie. All in all, you should see it, and you will enjoy it; so will I seeing it the second time with my husband; so good is it!

Review title: Not in the same league as The Wrestler
Review_body: Can't believe the rating of this movie on IMDb. Apart from the acting by Hardy this is drivel. There's no depth whatsoever to the characters and that the two brothers would end up fighting each other is so predictable it almost cancels out the high school leveled biblical intentions. Even Rocky has great depth compared to this, all five of them.There's supposed to be severe hurt in the main characters of the story. Too bad it doesn't come through. The opportunity to really feel with the father and brothers never arise as they are given no time to become real people. They're just put in three formatted frames that everybody has seen at least 200 000 times before. One- the guy about to lose everything he's got and has to fight to survive. Two- the alcoholic trying to redeem himself and falls off the wagon when confronted with result of his previous life. Three- the barrel of rage in the form of a deserted son.All three very good ingredients to put in a movie-stew. But the taste of this one is sadly bland.

Movie is very entertaining and tells a great story. The fight scenes are very well done and both actors clearly look like MMA fighters.I think Nick Nolte really was the star of this film. His portrayal of the father who is trying to reconnect with his sons is spot on. Nick's old grizzly look and emotional outbursts bring great emotion to the film. In addition, Tom Hardy really showed great acting skills with his acting and his character is someone that grows on you.The movie never drags on and the pacing of the movie is perfect. The only complaint I have about the movie is the ending. It was cut short and I feel there was still a story to tell.

Review title: Fairly clichéd sports film elevated by performances of power.
Review_body: 'Warrior,' has previously been compared to 2010's 'The Fighter,' an easy comparison to make. Both are centered on professional fighting, yet the true bulk of the story comes in it's portrayal of a highly dysfunctional family. However, whereas I found 'The Fighter,' to be quite overrated and fairly dull, 'Warrior,' is not. Primarily because of a holy trinity of incredible performances from its three male leads, Tom Hardy, Joel Edgerton and Nick Nolte. Whereas the film is fairly conventional in its plot and direction, the sheer power of these three truly elevates the film to something great.The plot is fairly conventional and there aren't many surprises, which is perhaps the film's greatest weakness. However, the three main players consistently keep the audience engaged with three wholly different performances. Joel Edgerton is Brendan Conlon, a former fighter turned physics teacher who's struggling with his finances following his daughter's expensive treatment for a heart condition. His friendly every-man is perhaps the most likable of the three male family members. Brendan reluctantly returns to the ring in order to support his family, much to his wife's dismay. Edgerton gives a great performance, the struggles of a man trying to keep everything together conveyed perfectly. Tom Hardy, as his younger brother Tommy, is also exceptional. His pained performance is one of Hardy's best, in both emotional depth and physical appearance. Hardy has obviously bulked up for this film, and his dedication pays dividends. This is a great physical performance, and a true definition of an actor giving everything to his role. However, his character can at times be quite unpleasant, and as a result I found myself failing to connect with Tommy as I did Brendan. His pain is evident, yet he seems oblivious to the pain that he inflicts on other characters. However, the best performance of the film, and one deservedly nominated for an Oscar, was Nick Nolte's tortured, formerly alcoholic Paddy Conlan, the boys' father. Nolte is explosive, an actor at the top of his game. One scene in particular is absolutely shattering in its potency and is delivered perfectly. Nolte should have won the Oscar.However, as I've mentioned previously, the plot is fairly obvious, and this is the film's greatest flaw. There aren't many surprises, and it's a shame the story didn't do much to differentiate from others in the sports/fighting genre. The strength of the performances may do much to bring this film to greatness, but the plot hampers its ability to be rendered a classic. The fighting is well choreographed, the score rousing and the direction solid, if a little uninspired. 'Warrior,' is a good film, maybe even a great one, hampered only by the obviousness of its plot. See it for the performances rather than the story however, and you'll be in for a good show.

Do you seek the movie that leaves a lump in your throat? Do you seek a movie with emotional depth because you yearn to 'feel' something more than the mundanity of your world? Do you seek a genre-defining movie? If the answer is 'yes' to any of these questions, you've found that movie. This isn't Rocky, although I understand comparisons because it's a 'fighting movie' firmly rooted in drama. It's better than Rocky. Much better. Don;t be fooled, this isn't a film about fighting in a physical sense. It's a film about fighting in the spiritual sense. Two brothers provide the core of something very special. Just watch it. And feel the tingles.

Warrior tells the story of two brothers in their quest to succeed using MMA as their gateway to success. Tommy Riordan played by Tom Hardy plays an ex war veteran feeling the demoralizing affects from the war who feels that his life has lost a sense of meaning as if it has run its course. Tommy enters the MMA tournament in efforts to relinquish any self-doubt and shed a new light into his life back home from the war. Tommy's brother Brendan played by Joel Edgerton, enters the tournament in hopes of winning to save his family from their financial crisis they are in. The two brothers never had a good relationship being that Brendan(Edgerton) abandoned his brother and abusive father when he was 16. Tommy (Hardy) never truly forgave him as they both parted their separate ways in life. The two of them end up fighting for the championship.As someone who has done MMA for 5 years, this movie instantly appealed to me. However, the one thing that I enjoyed most about the movie was the fact that you don't have to have current or prior knowledge of MMA in order to like the movie. Unlike most sport movies in which the movie mainly revolves around the actual sport itself, Warrior focus more on the tarnished relationship of Brendan and Tommy. It also focuses on the relationship they have with their father (Nick Nolte) who abused them when they were kids. Their father desperately attempts to win both of them back though the horror of his actions make it difficult for his two sons too.Tom Hardy executes his bad ass character to near perfection as the same goes for Edgerton. As the movie progresses you get a real genuine idea of how broken and weak the relationship is between Tommy, Brendan and their father.The movie is incredibly moving and intense. You really get the feel for how important family is by the end of the movie. The last scene where Tommy and Brendan fight is one of the most powerful and riveting scenes I have witnessed in cinema. It is not the fighting that makes that last scene so powerful, but how emotionally driven the scene is.Fantastic movie regardless of your views or knowledge on MMA.

With pulse pounding fight sequences and well crafted family drama, Gavin O'Connor presents the marvelous Warrior. Warrior succeeds not only what every sport movie has done in recent years, but what most dramas have done. Tom Hardy, Joel Edgerton, and Nick Nolte all deliver Oscar worthy performances that will leave you stunned. These actors really make you feel for their characters.The fight sequences are well directed and will leave you with sweaty palms and a nervous stomach. Warrior is possibly the one sports movie that can be compared to the glorious Rocky. This is the only sports movie that can make you as nervous as that film. All in all, make sure you see Warrior, you do not want to miss it.

Come on now. I was super excited to see this movie after all the glowing reviews. Let me check that. Unrealistic, false left-right paradigm, superficial emotions, contrived story, the one brother is vilified while the other is made a hero. Super predictable, no training sequences, cheesy Joe Rogan wanna be announcers, and average acting by the supporting cast.While Rocky was about an average man overcoming great odds with sheer determination who fought for glory there is nothing average about this crappy, super far fetched storyline. One brother, who is fighting under his deceased Mom's maiden name, is bitter who hates everybody and is so mean to his Dad that it causes him to break his sobriety of 3 years. Apparently his only friend in the core was killed in a friendly fire bombing (where he was the only one who lived) and he promised the purse money of the tournament his fallen comrades wife. However, she sells him out to the media who discover his real identity and then he faces a court martial after the tournament because he went AWOL after his friend died. Oh, did I mention on his way out of Iraq (apparently on foot) he walks into a battle, saves a life and becomes a war hero? The other brother is loved by everyone, especially all the 25 year old actors playing high school students where he teaches physics to cheer leaders. He is underwater on his house because his one of his daughters has a heart condition and needs the money to pay off the bills. (Not really sure what his wife did for a living.) Of course, the brothers relationship is estranged because of complications of their mothers death. The two meet in the finals after the marine brother wins 3 straight fights by 10 second knockouts. The other brother, who is always the underdog, pulls off submission upset after upset. Geez, I wonder who is going to win in the finals?Yawn. If this was supposed to be good, this is just another reason why I barely waster my time watching movies. It's fodder for the uniformed, discerning, zombie masses.

Review title: I was blown away by this movie
Review_body:
This movie is not in my usual genre. I'm not big on watching drama movies, having had enough of it in my own life.
I had never see. Joel Edgerton or Tom Hardy in anything before.
As I i into got to the movie, I could certainly begin to relate with many situations and characters.I was drawn onto this movie with powerful intensity. I was riveted by everything. Nick Nolte as the repented alcoholic father touched me. My father was an alcoholic who never repented or tried in any way, so I sympathized with his character, while also sympathizing with the brothers pain and anguish over what his drinking did to their family.I was deeply moved by the rift in the brothers relationship. Another relatable situation. I felt myself pulled deeper and deeper to the characters, expertly acted by all three actors. They did so well I literally get every bit of anger and pain.The end fight was the most powerful, emotional scene in a movie. It ranks very high for me for the top spot. The music chosen was superb to capture the essence of the brothers relationship and catharsis. It was violent, and harsh and rough, but there was a beauty to it and a real, honest human element that many of us can relate to.Again, not normally my kind of movie, this has become one of my favorites and is on the top shelf of my movie case.Beautifully acted, beautifully shot, beautifully directed. It did not receive the recognition it deserved

Review title: While Predictable And Not Wholly Original, This Poignant Film About Two Brothers Is A Total Knockout
Review_body: This Tom Hardy and Joel Edgerton film about two brothers fighting in a Mixed Martial Arts competition is so much better then I went in expecting. Filled with heart and passion, what could have been another wrestling/boxing/sports movie was elevated by the fact that it was brilliantly acted and directed. Warrior is a pretty standard and straight forward story, and may be let down a bit by its predictability, but it overcomes these issues because it is so much better overall then many of its similar cousins out there. The performances by Hardy, Edgerton and Nick Nolte are astonishing, and drive Warriors to being a great film instead of just a good one. The direction is inspired and the cinematography truly captures the atmosphere and violence of the sport the main characters are taking part in.Occasionally, Warriors uses clichés, but again, these are thrashed by the heart and emotional story that they're used in. The screenplay is where the film struggles most, but it is almost always entertaining so it can be easily ignored. Warriors could have been just another Rocky clone, but instead it goes above and beyond expectations by focusing more on the characters instead of the sport the film revolves around, something many Rocky clones don't understand. Warriors is much better then expected.4 / 5

This movie was recommended by a friend and it took me a while to see it. I watched the trailer and I thought it's another film about fighting.So, when I saw it last night, finally, I was thunder struck by how good the acting was right from the very first scene. I didn't expect that at all. I knew that Nick Nolte is a good and underrated actor but the fact that he is old made me think about Al Pacino and Robert de Niro and some of their last films. But in Warrior, Nick Nolte did an outstanding performance worthy of an Oscar. About Warrior. The script and the way it was filmed, had me engrossed since the very beginning, the characters story was heart breaking and the director and the writers made me feel for both brothers and for the father, giving them an amazingly sad life previous what the movie shows and I cheered for all of them. I didn't expect a "muscle man" to really act, getting accustomed with Stallone and Arnie's lack of skills, and Tom Hardy proved me wrong. I liked the way he played Tommy, making him an indestructible but fighting his own demons throughout the movie. And Joel Edgerton was new for me because I really didn't pay attention to him or his roles before. They both did an amazing job showing the hurt and the everlasting bond between two brothers. Maybe Warrior is a big and old cliché since it isn't the first or the last of his kind but I don't care. The last 20 minutes I cried my heart out for both of them and in all my life I didn't cry so much for some fictional characters. I give it 10/10.

Every person I recommend this to thinks it is such a good movie. Leaves you full of emotions by the end. Deffo the best movie of 20111. Deserved a lot more Oscar noms than it got. On top of Nick Noote, Joel Edgerton and Tom Hardy were brilliant in it. Career bests for them both.
One of my favorite movies of all time. Cannot recommend enough

The beauty of this movie lays within its originality.It must have torn Americans as the two things they seem to value most are their family and their army....I mean.. who would you want to win? It was a difficult choice!Thankfully, a Brit came to the rescue to take the lead role and cement this movie as what I believe with one day be looked upon as a classic!

Review title: Likely best movie seen this year.
Review_body: The approach the movie takes in developing every character is truly excellent. All three main characters, Nick Nolte, Tom Hardy and Joel Edgerton have outstanding performances. I am a guy who appreciates MMA and this movie gave it justice. Watch this movie and get ready to see an quality flick.

I don't usually write movie reviews, but I felt compelled to after seeing this sensational film. I can't believe that it didn't get a wider release in Canada, or somehow slipped by me. I am not a big UFC fan, or fight fan for that matter, and nor is my wife (who balled her eyes out in several emotional climaxes of the film); so don't believe that it's a film only for fight fans. It is in fact more of a family drama with UFC as the vehicle and backdrop in which to tell that story.Nick Nolte is amazing in this movie, and totally steals every scene he is in. Tom Hardy is incredibly different than anything he has done before and I commend him for it. Joel Edgerton is perfect as the family man you can't help but route for. In fact, I found myself wanting nothing bad to happen to any of the main characters in this movie and that's why it was such a success. The characters are developed perfectly and it grabs you emotionally without you realizing.In conclusion, let me make some bold statements: This is my favourite film of 2011. I hope more people get to see it as it is excellent. I also think it is a better film than Rocky, but obviously not as groundbreaking. whoa, right!

Review title: One of the best films of this year!!!
Review_body: After seeing the trailer to Warrior many times, I wanted to see this movie from the start. When I bought it on DVD, I was shocked of this film. I love all performances from Tom Hardy, Joel Edgerton, Jennifer Morrison and Nick Nolte. The story line behind the film wasn't any ordinary where one guy loses everything in the beginning and battles back over obstacles at the end and rise about everything. You get many stories through this whole film where Nick Nolte is a recovering alcoholic, Joel Edgerton and Jennifer Morrison are a married couple with two girls and they are just like any other American family. Working two to three jobs to help their kids and doctor bill as well. Then there comes Tom Hardy's character where he plays a Marine that goes AWOL after his brother in arms in killed and he saves a fellow marine in the process. He returns home and asks the help of his father to train him for an MMA (Mixed Martial Arts) tournament. By far, this movie has Oscar buzz flowing around it. Gavin O'Connor coming from making Miracle to this is a big step forward in his career. I just liked it cause within 15 minutes of the movie, there is a fight.

Review title: This is what a great movie should be like
Review_body: Warrior is without a doubt one of those movies that contain everything a good movie should: an original and interesting story; great acting; suitable music; and a perfect mix of entertainment and emotion.It's been mentioned here before, but I'll say it again. It is truly surprising and undeserving that this movie didn't get more attention. Or maybe it did, and I just happened to miss it.Anyhouw, I really recommend to see this movie. I'm not such a huge fan of fighter films, but Warrior was truly worth my time. It'll grab your attention and hold it until the very last second.I've seen a couple of movies with Tom Hardy in it, but this was definitely one of his greatest parts.Lastly, Warrior was one of the few movies that just literally left me speechless at the end for several minutes. Congragulations to the entire crew! They've done a really great job with this one!

Went to see this film on it's opening night last year and I was blown away, Warrior is the best fighting film since Rocky all those years ago, that's the best accolade I can give it.The story is brilliant, the script is cheesy at times but is very good. As for the acting, it's top class all across the board, but Nick Nolte & Tom Hardy are the standout performances for me. Nick Nolte's performance as the former alcoholic father of Tommy(Tom Hardy) & Brendan(Joel Edgerton) is absolutely brilliant and the scene between him and Hardy is very emotional and probably Nolte's best scene.And then one of the most talented actors around at the moment, Tom Hardy who plays Tommy Riordan a former marine who returns with a chip on a shoulder and is an unbeaten MMA fighter since he school days and Tom plays this role to perfection and if it were up to me, he'd be up for an Oscar along with Nick Nolte who also rightly deserves the nomination.And Joel Edgerton who plays Brendan, who's settled down to a family lifestyle and works as a teacher but is in debt and Joel Edgerton also pulls out a great performance.The action scenes and fights are very hard hitting but what makes it brilliant is the story of the brothers and the emotion in the film. There's certain plot holes and problems with the film like there is in any film but the 2 hours and 20 minutes fly by.The ending is one of my favourite endings, but it is a little bit corny but I loved it and a couple of scenes made me cry, the ending will make you tear up at least, made me cry anyway.You need to watch Warrior because for me it was the film of 2011 and one of my favourite films of all-time.

Review title: if in the end he didn't tapped and won with a broken shoulder it was awesome movie
Review_body: I've noticed a lot of people complaining that the ending spoils the film and is clichéd because the underdog and not the better fighter wins and i am one of them, if you take out the last half hour from the movie it was perfect 10 on 10 but a fighter like Kobe with such experience lost to a school teacher , i cant digest that and in all of his fights he was taking the beating still won all of them in a similar fashion. and apart from Kobe and two brothers it was evident none of the other fighters had any chance because they had no limelight in movie, so top16 fighters in world and you come with this? fighting scenes were good and real in starting but in the end it was shown in movie that you cant beat that teacher because it does not matter the amount of beating he will have he will still stand up and win by submission somehow 3 times in a row , i wondered why other opponent were so dumb to not to submit him when they were so dominant. and why the hell tommy was not able to take the teacher down in a fashion like he destroyed his other opponents ? just because you wanted to show a good fight between brothers in end? these things are so away from reality + the format why brothers were not scheduled to fight earlier or Kobe fight with brothers in start ? as if format was also tricked . only plus point is the story other than fighting.

Review title: people used to have higher standards
Review_body:
I know these 'Rocky 'movies use poetic license, but come on!
this was called a middleweight tournament, which means their weights should be similar, and Koba was 50 to 70 pounds heavier than most of them.also, the teacher in his first fight was being choked for like 8 seconds, and they don't call the fight?and its one thing for Rocky to get an upset and defy the odds. It is yet another for a mild mannered physics teacher who has not fought in a while to win an MMA fight where, unlike boxing, you really have to be nasty.the worst part, however, was that the whole movie really focused on a certain relationship and that relationship was never resolved.the movie had a good story line, and had great potential, but either lazy or stupid writing sabotaged it.just curious for the people who loved the movie, do these things not bother you?

It's rare for me to get so emotionally involved with characters in a movie, but this is a film that did it for me. If you don't already know, the film is about two brothers who end up fighting each other for $5,000,000. There are so many things that this film got right, that I have no idea how it didn't get nominated for best picture. The story was great, the dialogue was excellent, and the characters felt very real. The back stories behind the two fighters makes it so you want to root for both of them and when the end comes you don't know who to root for. I have never watched a fighting film where I had no idea who I wanted to root for until watching Warrior. Nick Nolte played an excellent role as the once alcoholic father, and Tom Hardy was excellent as Tommy. When I first saw Tom Hardy in Inception, I thought of him playing roles that are meant to be sarcastic, however this movie changed that opinion. His character was isolated, angry, and cold hearted and Hardy captured it perfectly. I would put his character in the same category as Christian Bale in The Fighter. This movie had everything that I was looking for and more. It had awesome fighting scenes, emotions, and great character development and dialogue. I would highly recommend this movie even to people who don't like MMA. It's hard to watch this movie and not become emotionally involved with them and for me, that's what makes a great film. In my opinion this is a better movie than The Fighter, and one of the best films I have seen in a long time.

when the average rating of the movie is 8.3 u already knew that the movie is brilliant.this movie is a worth watching movie although it will cost more then 2 hours of your life movie is very long as compare to the other movies but in every second u can see the hard work to make it.The most exciting part of the movie is TOMMY(Tom Hardy) section of fights pure 3 knockouts make u wanna cheer for him every detail of the of the matches feels u are sitting right of your TV screens and watch a live match.This movie has a tendency to claim as a 10/10 acting in superb story brilliant music spot one.BUT i reduce the two points only for its climax It could be better like if TOMMY wins the fight and hugs his brother.or we can see some the after story of the brothers.SSROCKS1995@GMAIL.COM

Review title: Gut wrenching action and emotions that will make your cry... The perfect movie
Review_body: When the movie started, i realized it is not just another movie i went to see in theatre, it's much more than that. But the movie truly surpassed my expectations. I was shell shocked during the movie with action, emotion and bone breaking shots. While we guys consider movies like Never back down, the fighter, fighting with utter respect, but believe me guys Warrior stands tall against these movies. you know MMA stuff man that kills it.Tom hardy delivered the perfect emotional punch in the movie along with the bone crushing jab. The story revolves around an estranged family which is haunted by alcholism, favoritism and domestic abuse. Nick nolte played the role of drunk father in past who leads to the separation of his family. In the past he favored his younger son in the wrestling training over his elder one, left his wife when she was ill, part ways from his family. As a result, Tom hardy moves with his mother with a heart full of hatred, anger. After her mother's death he enlisted in the marine, where he saved the life of fellow marines but become AWOL without claiming any medal. On the other side his elder brother moves with his girlfriend gave a switch to his carrer by becoming Physics teacher. While their parent trying to recover from alcholism.The movie would have been a violence filled, bloodied, clichéd, to other MMA movies if sole focus was on the fight scenes. But it is much more than that, thanks to Gavin o conner Who worked on making strong characters and these characters are well displayed by the perfect acting of the three main actors. Hardy and nolte deserved the academy award for such a fabulous performance.The only negative lines i hold for this movie is about the ending where it is left to decide for themselves about the character after the last fight. It would have been good if last scene might have put some insight about the life of both brothers and their father after the last fight.This movie is for all the Man and women who wants to go out there and watch a nice movie. A FULL ENTERTAINER....

Warrior: The title and cover let assume this film might be some uninteresting, run-of-the-mill fighting film.
The truth is: It is some highly underrated story about the brutal, inner fight between two estranged brothers. With their entrance into a MMA (Mixed Martial Arts) tournament they come to terms with each other and their lives.I can't believe it didn't get more attention.
I love it very much and was positively and pleasantly surprised when I watched it the first time.In my opinion it is one really deep storyline with a brilliant Tom Hardy, an awesome Joel Edgerton and a touching Nick Nolte. The performances are outstanding. I highly recommend to watch the making of as well to get some background information about the process and preparations.
Warrior is great and sad at the same time. It shows you how painful and powerful sometimes life can be. The story is moving.Warrior is a well made drama with stunning MMA acts. Beethoven makes it perfect.
A big hit for me!

I usually write very long winded, very analytic psychosomatic reviews of films. However, words just don't do this one justice.Hardy is quite quickly becoming one of the best actors on the planet and if you thought he was good in "Bronson", you ain't seen nothing yet. Nick Nolte delivers an Oscar winning performance that would put most of the Hollywood "Elite" to shame and Edgerton is so brilliant that I forgot I was actually watching a piece of fiction.Don't download it or watch a poor copy, don't rent it, hell don't even buy the official Blue-Ray. Watch this on the big screen. It will be the best thing you ever do.

Bought it, watch it, cry with it. A movie about no heroes. It's a movie about human beings.Five warriors are presented in this movie. The guy fighting the economy, the necessity to survive with his family in the modern world. The other brother, fighting memories and for the honour of someone else. Both sons fighting against their devils from childhood. The old man, Paddy, is that devil from the past and he's fighting hard for a last glimpse of redemption. The wife, fights with desperation for the wellness of her family, wanting her husband to get away from harm. But the last warrior is you. You will fight with thousands of emotions. All the characters are fighting for the humblest and more beautiful ideals and hence it's impossible to cheer less for anyone. This brings a gigantic complexity to the plot and the final showdown, which, will bring you to wish for every character to achieve their goal, something that the events and structure of the plot render as an impossible.They're all humans and for that, you can't pick a human over the other...

Review title: Good beginning , great action, bad end
Review_body: Yes it was very good movie. Very best in fighting categories. But i want to add something disturbed me. Lets see;First take Tommy. He is a tank. Literally. A mean his body , his power he almost unstoppable. He wins all match nearly don't take any punch or kick except final. He beat up all his rivals like a super hero. But he hate his father and brother so he became bad person in scenario. The topic i really understand is , tommy end up with his brother like they hate each other since ever, why scenarists trying to show us? A mean to what end ? This is the weak part of the movie.Second take Brendan. He is family guy and broke. And he is old and considering to his rivals, he is nothing. He taken beat every match and he wining all of them by some tactics.Another weak part of scenario is the tommy didn't use all his power on his brother somehow. Brendan take huge beat from tommy and he have still power to strike back, and miracle happens for Brendan win the match and emotional end with "i love you tommy". In the end if anyone like rocky series must see it!

Review title: Warrior is a good fight flick but might make you cry if you have daddy issues
Review_body: Helloooo!! Just checked out this sleeper and it was OK. Cinematography and themes are similar to the fighter but the acting is no where near and the mma thing isn't as big of a deal as you would think. The main point of the movie is the effects of alcoholism on a family. Nolte is great as always as a former boxer and wrestling trainer to his sons. After years of drinking his family is torn apart. His two sons hate him and they all go their separate ways. One to war,,,One to a family. Through hardships in both their lives they turn to ring matches for financial gain. Thus a modern day kumite bloodsport style movie is born. Of curse its tapout mma stuff and not backbreaking action. The best parts of the movie are the scenes between Tom Hardy kicking some major ass and not showing emotion or he's making Nick Nolte feel like a complete p.o.s. for being such a bad father in the past. This is really a "BRO" movie. Some OK fights but pretty predictable. Redbox it up,,,,but could be an OK present for an mma fan that has daddy issues

You could over think this to much, but simply, this film is STUNNING!!!!. Tom Hardy in probably the best film he's ever made in the best character he's ever portrayed. It emoted the right emotions, at the right times and you really believe in the cause. Tom Hardy IS the Warrior.You need to watch this film. You have to watch this film. The best film for the last 10 years. I hope there's a not a ''Warrior 2'' - lets not kill it guys, lets keep the magic where it should be. I'm not sure I want to write anymore for this as to be honest the first line said it all - but due to guidelines, you've got to do 10!

people, people...where is the good part in this movie? Deep characters? Don't think so. OK, some good action/fight scene's, but a very shallow storyline: "i need money, lets pick up fighting again, o what a surprise, i'm one of the best in the world...". Comon. Wife "no, you will never fight again". Man: "but we need the money". Wife: "ok then". And then the fights themselves. Of course our hero starts with losing, but then, surprise surprise... he wins! The whole storyline about the two brothers and their past with mom & one of them running of is never really worked out.Does NOT deserve an 8!!

Review title: Action for the boys + emotion for the girls = Great Date Movie
Review_body: I loved this movie! Initially I thought my husband would like this movie, I hate to admit that I would normally never watch a movie like this simply based on the subject matter; cage fighting. But I'm glad I listened to the reviews.Right from the beginning, starting with The National song, it felt real. It didn't feel over acted, everyone was natural and the pace made sense.The story was brilliant, meaningful and relatable. The action/fighting was exciting, even for someone that doesn't normally like this type of sport. But by far my favorite was the emotional pull each character brought to the movie. The complex family dynamic was enthralling.My only complaint is that it took me so long to see it.

Review title: Great fighting scenes, some great acting, and an OK storyline.
Review_body: I was not entirely sure what to expect from 'Warrior.' Admittedly, the title is what put me off for a while. But being in the mood for Tom Hardy films recently, I decided to give it a go. I am glad I watched it.Tom Hardy was great in the film. His American accent was convincing enough, and his mysterious, tough-guy character was played well. Joel Edgerton was good, too. Just not as good as Hardy. Nick Nolte, however, stole the show in terms of acting. He played his role with perfection.The storyline was somewhat predictable, but that will always be expected from a film such as this. On the other hand, the fighting scenes were great and made the film very entertaining. They were very realistic, and a lot of the time will have you on the edge of your seat as though it's a real mixed martial arts fight you're watching, and you know one of the fighters.All in all, entertaining throughout, but it is a story you can probably guess the ending to before the film starts. It is definitely worth a watch.

As a 40-something movie addict, I've been waiting the best part of my life to watch a fight film that could trade blows with what I considered to be the best of them, that being Rocky - the first one that is, don't get me started on the rest.To be totally honest, I didn't expect to find a challenger in Warrior - I hadn't even heard of it until a few days ago and despite the high praise it has received here at IMDb, I was still extremely cynical. The benchmark set in Rocky is so high, that every other fight film I sit down to watch is almost doomed before I press play, and invariably they fall down.Finally I can say that there is a new champion, and Warrior is it. I won't go into lengthy detail, suffice to say it has everything that Rocky has but just that little bit more on each and every level.
