Emotionally, technically and acting wise Warrior does not relent, and the 2hr 20m runtime literally flies by, leaving the viewer completely shell-shocked, exhausted and begging for another hour - the mark of a true gem.A genuine tour-de-force that will have you screaming at the screen, the hair standing on the back of your neck and your pulse racing - regardless of whether or not you like sports films. I'll be watching this again, back-to-back with the newly deposed Rocky very soon - and you should too.The king is dead - long live the Warrior. 9.1 / 10

The biggest pile of predictable BS. I waiting and waited for a twist but there was no payoff at all. And talk about being unrealistic. The only thing more unbelievable in movies history was Kevin James winning and MMA fight. Don't waste your time.

Review title: Try to do too much much?
Review_body: The movie tried to do too much. It feels like over half of the movie is dedicated to establishing each brother's background and all of the reasons you should be rooting for that brother--all with the Tom Hardy character barely saying a word. Yet you recognize all along that if either brother has a chance at realistically winning a tournament that includes these 2 brothers and 14 pro fighters, including apparently a couple of the top ones in the world, it's him. The teacher--the film clearly establishes that even as a younger, full-time fighter he was middling at best and that first part of his career ended with him being put into an ambulance and taken to a hospital nearly dead. Now, years older and rusty, but desperate for money, he's capable of taking down some of the best fighters in the world. Hey, at least he takes some punishment along the way. Then after 4 punishing fights in under 2 days, he steps into the ring against his brother, who has walked through 4 fights, easily knocking other fighters out in under 10 seconds each. He's completely fresh. And despite the fact that they're all fighting as middleweights, Hardy and all of the other fighters look like they weigh 20 pounds more than the teacher, easy. At some point during the tournament, the media finds out that Tommy, a war hero, has deserted his Marine unit. But they find this out weeks after a video of him knocking out a top fighter during a sparring session has gone public. The way the media really works, you know that would have come out about an hour after the video did. And the person who gives him away, apparently, who rats him out, is the woman he's trying to win 5 million dollars for... And the Nick Nolte character could have just not appeared in the film at all. Former alcoholic and wife-beater who's been sober for a little under 3 years, does nothing really to earn his sons' forgiveness but hope strongly. The son who seems to hate him more, and actually tells him he has no use for him, is the son who has had him as a trainer for half the movie. And then the guy goes back to drinking. There's no character development, no sympathy build up for the guy at all. You could have just had both kids say they hate the father, have Hardy prepare himself without a trainer, and be done with it. The 4 stars here are because the film actually tried to do something. It fails miserably, though, and isn't really worth the watch. It's 2 hours and 20 minutes and would have needed to be an hour longer to explain things enough to the point where it would even approach being watchable.

Review title: one of the greatest fighting movies out there
Review_body: i never thought i'd say this but.....i love this moviesince the first minute i thought to myself "this movie actually gets it good" and so i watched it till the end and i regret nothing about it the acting is so smooth and well played, the plot is all i imagined and better, the fighting moment look like fighting moments and not a high school fight and even better is the way all ties up well ..... not in the way i would like it to be but it ties up so good i even got a tear down my cheek finally is the soundtrack in the last moments they chose it and placed it at the perfect moment "about today" by the national made it a tense moment and a memorable one if it would have more memorable moments and "tearfull" moments it would have easily a 9.5/10 in my opinion9/10-tommy approves

Review title: Emotion Roller coaster, is not too cliche for this film
Review_body: This is a movie lovers film, from start to finish, it tugs at your heartstrings and exploits every emotion you can imagine. This is Nick Nolte's career apex. Absolutely brilliant writing and directing. BRAVO!!!!

I won't compare this movie to any other sports-drama movie. It is neither Rocky nor The Wrestler. To do this movie justice, one must appreciate its beauty in all aspects. The acting is excellent; especially on Nick Nolte's part. The story progression was not cheesy. Everything was delivered in a subtle and seamless way. As the story goes on, you get to connect the dots and understand where every character is coming from. The direction is simply awesome. The ending might be considered cliche by some, but I find it different. If you didn't watch this movie, you are missing out.

Review title: One of the most heart-breaking, emotional films I have ever seen.
Review_body: It's really hard to start with this movie. It basically covers two estranged brothers - One who has embraced a quiet, family life; the other, dedicated his time to the United States military. Through a series of events, they come in contact with each other again during a MMA tournament. Tom Hardy and Joel Edgerton capture the hearts of the fans with their emotional, tear-wrenching performances, with Nick Nolte as their father delivering the most emotional performance of them all. With the film being a MMA movie, it's strange to think that drama would be so prevalent but essentially it is the backbone of the story.The addition of The National's 'About Today' cements the final scene as a definite tear-jerker.

Review title: One of the best fight movies of all time!!!
Review_body: Simply put this is right up there with rocky films. So emotionally charged even i cried and im a 6ft 10 giant. ( lost count how many times ) i can watch anything with tom hardy, the guy is a true method actor and gets soooo into his roles. The fighting in and out of the ring was superb. Just watched it again 9 years after the first time and its still a 10/10 movie. This is one where your girlfriend will be like ohhh im not watching a film about fighting but i guarantee she will watch it to the end and you both will love it. No wonder it scores so highly... fantastically written with amazing choreography.. give it a go and i promise you won't br disappointed

Review title: One of the most over rated films I've ever seen
Review_body: Missed opportunity to make an excellent film. Cliched story, good fight sequences ruined by tried and untrue shaky camera technique, and a forgettable ending. Major plot points are totally unrealistic.

Review title: One the best movie of all time
Review_body:
Highly recommended , best acting and directing
Tome hardy is shining in this movie
I cheered! I cried! The acting was phenomenal. Tom Hardy is brilliant as always.

It is a really good movie but the camera angles during fights were so bas. Half-body shots, crowd closeups, punches, half-body shots again...you cannot really feel the fight that way. Maybe its becausw the main plot of the movie is not about MMS but the family drama around two brothers around it

Warrior follows the story of two brothers, split up by family when they are younger who both are in different situations, yet have the same aim. The biggest theme of all in the film being family, it is about the relationship between the two protagonists as not just brothers, but rivals, and as fighters. This sport/drama is enthralling from the get go until the screen fades to black and is a must watch even if you are not fans of MMA.

One of the most underated films of recent memory.
I cried, jumped, yelled and sat at the edge of my seat for most of the movie.
Excellent acting by every cast, a definit classic.
Fantastic movie with great writing. The direction and plot is unlike any other fighting movie. Should've been nominated for a bunch of oscars but it was snubbed.

The Drama of the family intersects in a sequence of inevitable events, which will lead the protagonist to review their relationships. but just when the breking of all bonds seems inevitable, we will find that life brings us back review our own decision and to give ourselfe a new chance. Phenomenal Tom Hardy and Nick Nolte.
Just one of the best drama fighting movies. Tom Hardy and the rest are perfectly cast. Good screenplay, so its a must see.

Review title: An absolutely beautiful, emotional and unforgettable film
Review_body: To this day, Warrior is one of, if not the best movies I have EVER seen. Actually, toss aside the one of part, it is the BEST film I've ever seen. Will shake you to your core regardless of your emotional fortitude. The true meaning of edge of your seat, screaming at the screen, fighting back your tears and actually shouting in celebration experiences.

Oh my God !That is the least you can say after seeing this movie. Let's start by saying that I am a huge fan of boxing and fighting film in general. My baseline for comparison until now was, of course, Rocky. After seeing Warrior, I might just have to change that baseline.What a movie, what a script, and to my surprise, what acting! Nick Nolte is, as usual, remarkable. But, to my surprise, Tom Hardy makes one of the best performances I have seen in years. I'm not going to spoil this for you, I am only going to tell you this: I was so reluctant to watch this film, and have had it for several months. After seeing it today, I'm truly sorry for not watching this earlier; after so many disappointing films, this is the one we have been waiting for...Must see !!!

Review title: I see what they were aiming for but hmmm..........
Review_body: I really think that the premise is there for a great movie about MMA, given its expanding fanbase, and really exciting action, but this movie won't be remembered as the "rocky" of its genre.They story is convoluted and predictable, Nick Nolte is wasted (figuratively) and Tom Hardy is not really given any range to explore his character. The action scenes are pretty good, but crucially you don't care enough about the people to care about the outcome. There are weepy subplots all over the place that don't get resolved, and again not enough time or thought is given so that you care enough to fill in the blanks.A fair effort, but crying out for some craft and guile in the script and filming.

Review title: wasn't enough build up, didn't make much sense
Review_body: there wasn't enough build up between the family, it didn't really explain their past. How are they great fighters? How do they enter a tournament without fighting before? they join a tournament with the 16 best fighters in the world but are amateurs. I could have made a better movie. The ending was original but not bad, but seems rushed. if the movie had been built up to show their past more, maybe to show how the brothers used to be really close but then their drunken father drove them away and the death of their mother caused them to lose contact. Im not sure how this movie got a 8.3... nothing special happens i would give it a 7 for the effort and that it is watch-able but not worthy of a 8.3

Review title: Warrior is one of the best sports films I have ever seen.
Review_body: Minor Spoilers ahead!Warrior is a fighting film, that mixes its stimulating fighting action with a engrossing story and comes out being one of the best movies of 2011.I have never been a huge Rocky fan. I watched it allot when I was little and revisited it about two years ago, but it didn't grab me. Then The Fighter came out in 2010 and I was absolutely blown away. All three of these films are about underdogs and their journeys to become the best fighter of their craft. In my opinion The Fighter is the best of the three with Warrior coming in second. I just don't find Rocking as moving or gripping as these two. With that being said, I'll continue with Warrior.Warrior is a drama, more than any other set genre. The screenplay was superb and it was only intensified by the acting. The cast was perfect all around. Tom Hardy did great as Tommy the big, hulking, silent type. He was one of the most interesting character to me. He was unpredictable and a really sympathetic and misunderstood character. Joel Edgerton played Brendan the older brother who seems to have everything put together, but we soon find out that because of a lack of finances, he decides to get back in the ring. Only ending in a suspension from his job as a teacher. Joel does a great job, but he is still not as memorable as Tom Hardy or the Academy Award Nominated performance by Nick Nolte. Nick Nolte plays the father of the two fighters. He is a recovered alcoholic who has been sober for 1000 days during the time of the film. Two of my favorite scenes in the film happened with confrontations between him and his sons. These two scenes are both nominee worthy and lets just say I teared up a few times throughout the movie.Besides the story the camera work fit the films structure. It was mostly Shoulder Mount and very up close and personal. The camera went a little crazy during the fights but I still managed to hang on and focus on everything that happened. I thought it was a wonderful choice by director writer Gavin O'Connor.Warrior is a superb cinematic experience and i loved every minute of it. It has become one of my favorite dramas in a while. Warrior is one of the best sports films I have ever seen. I give it my highest recommendation.

Personally i give it a 10 out of 10 because i loved everything about this film, including and especially the fighting (girl here). With a cast like this there is hardly anything bad you can say about it. It certainly has heart, certainly has a story, it makes you think, it makes you feel and it makes you relate..and it made me cry. It made me cry because when you look at just how much these men (the family) had been hurting by who did what, when and why which broke the family apart, and then what brings them together even if just about..you just can't help but to think and/or relate to it slightly and cry...or not. Anyway, in the end the money didn't even matter, sure this was the goal for either Tommy and Brendan at the beginning but it became about so much more than that, despite what happened in that ring which led to his defeat, it just really made you realise how much Tommy was hurting and how much Brendan wanted his little brother back, and the father his sons. I recommend this film to everyone even the non MMA fans. Everything made this film just perfect. Please watch it.

I wasn't expecting much from this movie. I knew it would have good fighting scenes but that's about it - boy was I wrong! At the beginning it seemed a bit boring but just stick around and keep watching you won't regret it. During every fight I was literally at the edge of my seat and so into it. The plot was deep and so were the actors and combined with the fighting it was all INTENSE. Loved the movie, I wished we could've seen more at the end or maybe I'm just greedy and always want more. One of the best action movies I've watched in a while, loved it. Definitely 10/10. halfway through I was already recommending it to people to go watch it; yes it's THAT good!

Review title: The untold tale of love and bravery
Review_body: The "Warrior" is justified to its fullest extent by the story which revolves around 2 brother and their father all spitted away yet woven together by the web of love. It is a story about two brothers who split ways in their teens because of their father's alcoholism. Younger brother Tommy departed with mom but elder brother Brandan decided to stay back for her girl-friend. This creates a rift between the brothers which resurfaces and dissolves when they clash against each other in arena of death and life.The movie opens with Tommy, the younger brother, an ex-marine returning to Pittsburgh, his home town to train for "Sparta" MMA (Mixed Martial Arts) under his father whom he treats as mere trainer and nothing more. On the other hand Brandan, an ex UFC fighter takes up a job as physics teacher and lives with his family close to yet far away from his father. Because of daughter's illness and other loans Brandan takes up fighting once again to meet the ends. However when the fight of Mr C (Brandan) gets public in the school he gets suspended for breaking disciplinary rules. Brandan left with no other option decides to take up fighting once again his profession to save his family and house(which was on verge of being taken away by bank) and trains under his friend Frank.Tommy catches a media attention when the video of knocking down champion "mad dog" in less than a minute, goes viral. On the other side Brandan gets better trough his training regime and when Frank's leading fighter gets injured days before the tournament, he convinces Frank to fight the game of death for five million dollars. In the tournament Brandan catches the glimpse of younger brother which takes him back a little. The story gets more gripping when their father Paddy Conlon in-spite of his desperate attempts to seek forgiveness of his sons is turned deaf ears by both the brothers.As the action begins in "Sparta" we see the two brothers in a total contrasting fighting techniques. Tommy was a destruct knocking down his opponents with hefty blows and leaving the arena in haste. Brandan was "never give up" character who patiently struggled and waited for his opponent to make the mistake and catch them on the wrong foot and finally getting them tapped out. Meanwhile Tommy's heroics of ripping apart a tank door and saving fellow marine comrades during war gains him unprecedented support from soldiers and audience.Each of the brothers defeat their heavy?? oppositions to make road towards the final clash. In the final battle in-spite of early pounding from Tommy, Brandan manages to survive and in the opportune moment gets grip over his brother. However Tommy was also amongst the ones who would give up and his ligament snaps accidentally. Brandan realizes this and seeks? his brother to give up as he doesn't want to hurt his brother any more. The support from fellow soldiers make Tommy fight in-spite of the excruciating pain of his dislocated hand.Brandan's word "you don't need to do this" definitely stirs the audience's emotions.The last scene of tommy crying over Brandan's shoulders and their father smiling at the reconciliation was the undoubtedly the best scene of the movie. The strong story line with some good action sequences makes this movie amongst the best sports movies, definitely in the league of Rockies and Cinderella Man.

The film follows two fighters and their families as they enter the fast big money martial arts (MMA) competition, Sparta. Brendan doing it for the family (Joel Edgerton) and a seemingly brutal Tommy who is looking for a payday (the suddenly ubiquitous Tom Hardy)with Nick Nolte as Paddy , a sad, reformed drunk of a father and we have the basic elements of another run of the mill sporting movie. Or at least that's how it starts. It examines family relationships and regret and faces the terrible truths when some wounds just cannot be healed by forgiveness once it is too late.It's not all family drama though and unsurprisingly it does have a lot of fighting in so even though I think it is enjoyable for most if you can't stomach the violence then don't bother with it. However the fighting is well balanced within the narrative, excellently shot and excitingly edited so we do not get the cliché slow-mo or the epic hour long battle even for the big finale. Some of the fights are brutally quick and even those that go the distance are edited down very well indeed while maintaining that punishing feeling - they certainly had the audience cheering and wincing along with every slam and punch. There will be blood along with some horrible curdling crunches too.My final verdict is that... this is an awesome film which pulls you with its intense action and great emotions..... story of a fighter.. a father.. son and a family..!!!!! must watch...!!

Warrior is a befitting descendant to the Rocky series and more recently The Fighter.Stallone shone not just as an actor, but more importantly, as the writer of the legendary fight movie (Oscar nominations for best actor, writer). Mark Wahlberg and Christian Bale added to Hollywood's fight legacy with splendid performances in The Fighter (Bale did get the best supporting actor Oscar for the same ... and deservingly so)."Warrior" too is characterized by absolutely superlative performances by the trio - Nick Nolte, Tom Hardy and Joel Edgerton.The story revolves around a broken family - two separated brothers (Hardy and Edgerton) and their father (Nick Nolte). Nolte plays a retired mixed martial arts champ who was responsible for breaking up his family. The reason is never known - but that does not dampen the story as it unfolds. He wants in, into the lives of his sons, but is constantly shunned out by them.Edgerton plays the elder brother, now married (to the lovely Jennifer Morrison of House MD fame - definitely want more of her!!), with two daughters and pressing financial needs. His portrayal as a 'Physics teacher' though short, is endearing. Hardy appears out of nowhere, before his father, after years of separation - as the story unfolds one realizes his secret past.The brothers, each of their own needs, decide to take up the UCF challenge with a heavy financial reward for the winner of the tournament. Their quest sets them up on a physical and emotional confrontation with each other.The fight sequences are grueling and elaborate - both actors evidently have worked hard at making them realistic. The sequences are absolutely stunning - the ones with Hardy for his sheer attitude around demolishing his opponent and the ones with Edgerton for his stunning Rocky-like portrayal of an unlikely underdog giving everything he has in every round.But the highlights of the movie are clearly the heart-wrenching moments between the father and his sons. Nolte simply excels as the remorseful father trying everything he can to become a part of his sons' lives.Though this is definitely a fight movie, the emotional quotient of the movie almost makes the elaborate fight sequences seem like an afterthought! Three cheers for Nolte, Hardy and Edgerton! Oscar nominations for the movie and the three leads for sure!!

Warrior is one of those films, you've got nothing to do on a Friday night, so you take a trip to the video store (even though your getting a DVD) and you pick it up and think, I'll give this a try.I get in the car and 2 mins down the road i've forgotten what movie I've chosen, in fact I'm contemplating a game of FIFA. No no I'll put this on.Wow, what can I say. I was expecting another Rocky in the Octagon and what I got was a film that delivers on so many emotional levels. Not only does it do this but it does it without a single molecule of cheese. That's where this film has succeeded for me. I'm not big on sports films and hands down this is the best of the genre I have seen.Lastly, I would also like to point out that Nick Nolte's performance is arguably one of the best performances i've seen on screen. His character is simple, with little complexity yet the acting was anything but.Highly recommended to anyone.

Review title: A Great Show well worth the price of admission
Review_body: If I could make one admonition to anyone reading this it would be to go to this movie with an open mind about the sport. You don't have to be a fan of MMA to like this movie, heck, you just don't have to hate everything related to it to be able to enjoy this masterpiece. The interpersonal relationships displayed in this film are presented impeccably and with such precision that you cannot help but care about the results of every action through out. If you can watch this movie without building an emotional tie to at least one of the characters, then maybe your life has been to easy and you need to take a walk to the other side of the tracks and let this movie open your eyes to the complexity and development of unconditional love. Warrior leaves the question to the audience as to who the title is attributed and it is definitely something worth thinking about. I thoroughly enjoyed this movie and recommend it with my highest regard to anyone looking for more than cliché fight scenes and high school drama.

Review title: A great experience to watch, filled with incredible fights.
Review_body: Watching this movie i a theater is hard. You may have problems staying quiet and not cheering out the characters. I rarely get attached to characters when watching a movie, but Warrior did just that. It starts out by building up the characters into people you want to see succeed. Not only is this a great movie about fighting, it is a fantastic movie about a broken family. Though there are several clichés along the story, you can't dismiss the fact that this is a movie that keeps you on the edge of your seat. When the climax comes i had no idea how it would turn out, it was simply a great experience watching this movie. I'll also have to mention that Tom Hardy did an amazing job with his character.

Awestruck Expected a good movie, got much more! Many blanks in storyline filled in so well with little dialog. Movie progresses without a pause, pulls you in on all levels. Emotions kept in check by the actors, run rampant throughout the audience. Movie is neither a "Rocky" nor a "Raging Bull," but more like the "The Great Santini" on emotional steroids. It tears at your heart and mind beginning to end! Nick Nolte seems out of his element and somewhat awkward, until his drunken scene hits a grand slam with the unleashing of unsaid demons sequestered in Hell for so long. Facial and body expressions painted under a veil of what seems a still frame filled with only the sounds of ones thoughts, brings a forceful turning point of a dysfunctional father and son (Tom Hardy) to accept and grant absolution in a confessional of a surprising embrace.The pièce de résistance is the powerful closing forcing the brothers (Hardy and Joel Edgerton) to confront the collision of love and hate in confines of a no win way-out. Superlatively carved out in graphic imagery, both the path and pain towards salvation is unmatched in modern film. As the brothers walk from the ring, the 1969 song "He Ain't Heavy... He's My Brother" by The Hollies most vividly comes to mind.

As a teenager, I'm definitely inexperienced in the world of MMA. But this movie is not about MMA, and that is set very clear from the start. Right from the start of the 2 minute trailer. So naturally I was ecstatic to take my seat in the theater.Tom Hardy (Tommy Conlon) delivers a moving and emotional performance of a man who has suffered greatly from the ones he loves, and from the field of battle, an all to real reality for people of today. While the younger Tommy suffered the loss of his mother firsthand, his older brother Brendan (Joel Edgerton)has put together a life that a man dreams of, yet is still haunted daily by his past. Only to have it threatened to be destroyed by the bank. Nick Nolte the alcoholic father of the two, has suffered years of remorse and regret from the abuse of alcohol and the neglect of his wife and children is trying to forge a bond but is meeting a stone wall with both of his sons.The fighting, though it is very well acted and shot, is not about fighting. It is the physical representation of the struggle between the three men, the struggle to forget and forgive and to move on. The demons that possess all three of these men are of such great proportion, the only way they can be relinquished is for them to come together.It hits home on such a high level on so many different subjects, that you will be floored into your seat as the credits roll in.An ABSOLUTE MUST SEE :)

Review title: One of The Best Sports Movies of All Time
Review_body: The movie Warrior, truly is a great movie. I enjoyed everything about it. It was inspiring, uplifting, real, and just flat out good. Everything a movie should be.You don't have to be an MMA or fighting fan to enjoy this film. But I'm sure you'll like it by the end. It pulls you in from the start, and you can't help but care about these characters. Played by Nick Nolte, Tom Hardy, and Joel Edgerton.Nolte is the father of Hardy and Edgerton, and both sons are MMA fighters trying to win a tournament for their own different reasons.Throughout the movie you're rooting for both these men, and hoping for the best. I have a brother and we saw this movie together. By the end, we didn't know whether to be happy or cry. And that's good.I was not disappointed with this film in anyway, and by the end of it, it almost brought a tear to my eye. I love this movie, and recommend anyone and everyone to go and see it.

Review title: How did this not win the Oscar for best picture?!?!?!
Review_body: This movie is amazing! No, not amazing, amazing does not even come close to its level of perfection. It was so great, I am forced to make up a word for it.... Scrumtralessent! But really, this is a great movie. Nick Noltie gives the performance of his life in this movie (nearl bringing me to tears at points) and Tom Hardy and Jeol Edgerton give it there all in this Rocky-Esq movie. The level of emotion and power given in this movie is unbelievable!If you have not seen this movie and are having doubts as to if you should or shouldn't watch this, only ask your self this question: "Do i want to see a moving and powerful film?" If that's a yes, watch this movie. It's not some MMA rock'em sock'em movie, it's a drama with some cool MMa stuff in it.This only makes me sadder to think how great this movie is, for not only did Nick Noltie not get his Oscar for this movie, poor Gavin O'Conner didn't get his Directing Oscar and best picture Oscar!

I guess I could go into explaining the true meaning behind the movie, the spiritual redemption and healing. Challenges and obstacles that appear before each character emotionally and physically to shut up some of the critics of this movie. But I wont. The bottom line for me is that when I get those goose bumps, or the hair raises on the back of my neck, or the intense feeling of wanting to jump out of my seat while I am watching a movie such as this one, then my own emotion tells the story that this was indeed one of the best movies I have seen. My only gripe is, I wish it was a little longer eg fight scenes and the hint of European accent during the chat between Brendon and his father. Tommy certainly had the demeanor of a Philadelphia fighter and a MMA tough guy while Brendon had the finesse and hints of Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu.

I have just watched Warrior for the second time and it hit me just as hard as the first. Hardy, Nolte and Edgerton along with the rest of the cast, deliver such an emotional and powerful story in Warrior. The film may not please those who want all-out MMA action but what it does deliver is a real-life story that we can relate to and believe. This film hits hard, both physically and emotionally, as we are reminded of what really matters in life; the love we have for those close to us. I, personally, think that the acting from the characters is real and you can feel it.I would highly recommend this to anybody who hasn't seen it yet, even if you're not the biggest fan of MMA.

Review title: Grabs your attention from the first scene
Review_body: This movie is one of those top dramas that will be remembered for a long time.From the first moment you meet the brothers and their father your asking questions. As the writers try and answer those questions they leave you with more.Learning about the brother personal stories makes you fall in love with each of them more and more. You'll want to see them both go all the way. Tommy is harder to love from the get go but you feel sad for him and just want to see him happy. Brendan is much easier character to love. He takes his family very serious, loves his wife unconditionally, and will sacrifice everything he has worked for in order to provide for his family. The fathers history with the boys is given right off the bat but his full story remains a mystery till the end.The action in movie really picks up as the fighting begins. You'll learn about why Tommy is the way he is and what he's really fighting for. Plus you get to see him kick some huge dicks ass twice. Even though he goes against the norm you still find yourself rooting for him in the end. His heart was always in the right place but never could show it until a scene that will absolutely make you cry. Brendan is always the underdog from the get go. Every one loves an underdog so its easy to just start cheering for him. He fights all the way through till the end. You can see that he truly loves his brother and just wants to be with him again.I won't tell you how it ends, you'll just have to watch it to find out! The end, however, is going to be the only reason that I don't give this movie a 10 out of 10. After you fall in love with these characters and see them battle against unbelievable odds to fight for what they love, the movie just ends. It just leaves you hanging there... I wasn't hoping for some fairytale happy ending I just would have like to seen more of the brothers together and not fighting.In the end I can't praise this movie enough. Its got the action for every guy on the face of the Earth and has the drama that will make your wife, fiancé, or girlfriend sit right there and watch it with you!

Review title: "Warrior" looks and sounds like a type of film we've all seen before; except this time, it actually works.
Review_body: "Warrior" Director: Gavin O' Connor Writers: Gavin O' Connor, Cliff Dorfman, and Anthony Tambakis Stars: Tom Hardy (Inception, Bronson), Joel Edgerton (The Thing), and Nick Nolte (Affliction)"Warrior" is the story of two brothers and their father, who's an ex-boxer and recovering alcoholic. When I say that, it sounds like a type of film we've all seen before; except this time, it actually works. Brendan Conlon, who is played by Joel Edgerton, is a former-MMA fighter who has left his alcoholic father and brother behind to start a new life. Brendan is now "living the American dream"; he has started a family and works as a high-school physics teacher. Things appear to be going great for Brendan and his wife (Jennifer Morrison); however, due to financial problems, Brendan and his family are about to lose their house. To make some extra cash, Brendan goes to apply for a job as a bouncer at a local "titty bar". Instead, he ends up participating in a small MMA event. Brendan wins but ironically things get worse. A video of Brendan's fight is uploaded to You-Tube; as a result, The school-board sees the video and Brendan gets laid-off from work. With no other option, Brendan trains and enters the big MMA tournament, "Sparta", to win the big prize money.Meanwhile, Tommy Ridoran (Tom Hardy), Brendan's younger brother, returns home after several years to his now sober father, Paddy (Nick Nolte). Paddy, who is now a thousand days sober, just wants to get to know his son and repair their broken relationship. Unfortunately for Paddy, you find out that Tommy wants hardly anything to do with his father. Tommy only wants one thing; he wants his old man to train him for the "Sparta" tournament. From That point on you can guess what the climax is."Warrior" has a simple, yet heart-throbbing story that could make the manliest man cry. Most of these "heart-throbbing" moments are with Nick Nolte's character, Paddy. (with a first name like Paddy, you feel even more sorry for him.) Paddy tries so hard to repair his relationships with both of his sons, Tom and Brendan, and nothing ever seems to go his way. "Warrior" teaches us that it's essential to forgive friends, and most importantly, family for wrong doings. At the same time though, "Warrior" also teaches us to never forget. Alright, so now your wondering how the Mixed Martial Arts are represented. One word: BAD- ASS. Do keep in mind though, this is coming from a guy that's never actually watched MMA before. With that said, it's pretty awesome. Tom Hardy's character, Tommy, ("Who's too small to play Bane in TDKR") is a F-ing monster. Tommy's first punch is always that last punch that gets thrown. Tommy immediately knocks out every opponent he encounters with only one hit. Tommy comes in, throws a punch, and walks out even before the ref can clarify that his opponent has been knocked out. Don't think for one minute though that Tommy's older brother, Brendan, is a weakling. Brendan (Joel Edgerton) might not knock out guys within one hit, but he can sure fight. He's the underdog of the story, and the guy that's probably the most relatable. I'm not spoiling anything when I say this, (They reveal it in the trailer and TV-spot) but when the two brothers collide in the climax, you're not sure who to root for. That's the great thing about "Warrior"; you genuinely like these characters.Edgerton, Hardy, and especially Nolte give great performances. Edgerton plays the underdog role so well, and Hardy plays the tough broken spirit like a violin. Nolte; however, steals the violin and plays it on steroids. I really believe that Nick Nolte deserves an Oscar nomination for "Best Supporting Actor". It probably won't happen, but at least it won't be the first time that The Academy has snubbed someone. We all remember last year's big snub, don't we.There are some problems with "Warrior"; fortunately though, they're very minor. The first problem I have with "Warrior" are the commentators at the MMA tournaments. Much like any sport that you watch, they never fail to be over obnoxious and just plain annoying. The commentators pull out some of the most inane dialogue that do not serve the least bit of significance. The second problem (much like the first) I have with "Warrior" is some of the dialogue. The good news is that 90 percent of the bad dialogue lies on the shoulders of the two idiotic commentators.Overall, I really enjoyed this movie and I advise everyone and anyone to see it. Like I said earlier, this movie can make the manliest man cry. In fact, this movie caters towards those kinds of people. "Warrior" is that "tough guy" movie with a huge heart at it's core. I give "Warrior" a 4 out of 5.-Colyn Kirkland

Review title: Hell yeah! This is a movie!!!
Review_body: In an era where most of the movies are rather disappointing, or even worse over-rated and they create a hype when they are usually pointless and boring, this film has you seating in the edge of your seat. Full of emotions, with not many extraneous scenes, gives you an adrenaline rush like no other recent movie. Good acting, believable characters and great fighting scenes. Good soundtrack too. I also liked how the back-story is created rather slowly and the pieces of the puzzle come together comfortably and are not pushed to the viewer just to get it over with. It left me feeling mixed emotions, unlike similar movies, it also made me think about the whole picture not just the fights.

Just saw a sneak peek of Warrior. All I can saw is WOW! Great film. Great performances. The characters are deep and believable and the story will probably have you leaving the theater in tears.The fight scenes were done really well. I've been cage side at hundreds of MMA fights as a photographer and believe me when I say this is some of the most realistically portrayed MMA action I've seen to date on film.Tom Hardy, Joel Edgerton, Jennifer Morrison and Nick Nolte all give good performances and I think Nick Nolte had a couple of moments in the film that should be considered Oscar worthy.I know a lot of people won't agree with me on this and I can understand, but Warrior has bumped Rocky out of my top 5 favorite movies of all time. IMHO (which some of you will consider worthless) I think it's that good.

Review title: A great sports movie - what did you think you were watching?
Review_body: To the low raters citing so called American clichés or holes in the plot as reasons to justify a weak rating...folks, it's a movie about Ultimate Fighting? What were you expecting - Shakespeare? That's like saying the English Patient was a terrible effort b/c it left you sad on the way out of the theatre! I'm not even a UFC fan and I still found this to be a great ride.This movie executes perfectly on what it's trying to be - a great sports movie. Think about the comparables - Any Given Sunday - star power that tries to distract you from the fact that they're not actually playing football or the Rocky movies that use distant camera angles to hide the fact that Sly doesn't like to get hit. This movie tells its story without slowing down. There are great characters and good writing in that there really aren't any missing links. There also some great acting beyond Nick Nolte but above all, there are great realistic action scenes. It's real on almost every level. It's hard to ask for much more given the theme - tons of entertainment value here folks.And for you disappointed people who were looking for a dramatic cinematic experience based on the failing human condition without the violence...here's a suggestion...look at the cover next time!

Review title: An exceptional movie and performance by key actors
Review_body: I've had this movie for around 6 months but never really wanted to watch it despite the rating it had on IMDb. The start was a bit dull and confusing for me but after that it just kept getting better and more exciting. Great story, great plot, great climax.Although the fighting sequences or techniques used could have been better and a bit more realistic it was well compensated by acting. If you are not a fighting fanatic this will be no problem for you.Would have given a 10 but considering it is primarily a MMA movie then the minus 1 goes to the fighting scenes.A gotta watch movie which will appeal to all mature audiences.

Review title: A very good, deep and emotional film
Review_body: I watched this film just last night after seeing a facebook status saying how "sick" it was. Sorry for the childish dialect there but we will move on. This movie started off quite slow, building up the characters but this was to be expected. Tom Hardy played the character well being someone with little show of emotion and did not talk much but however was shown to care although he may not have wanted others to think that. Nick Nolte being the ex-alcoholic father was also played well it's a shame he doesn't seem to be in as many films these days. Having never seen Joel Edgerton play a major role in a film I did not know what to expect. He was good although maybe too bland in some places but overall produced a good performance especially during the closing scenes.I like the story of the film. It was simple but had little extra things popping up throughout the film that added to the overall suspense of the ending. I found myself leaning up out of my bed biting my nails wondering what was going to happen to these two characters.Overall a very good film and well deserving of it's IMDb rating. Definitely worth a watch!

A story written with heart not brains. A story brought to life with some wonderful direction and an even better performances. The movie is so well written and directed that at one point in time you feel you are not watching the movie but actually living it. Only a few movies are ever able to accomplish this. A great combination of emotions and desire and guilt, which is sure to bring tears to your eyes. I simply loved the movie and is one of my favorite movies of all time.I especially loved the performance of Nick Nolte as a torn down old man longing for the acceptability of his own family.If you haven't watched this then you are missing something

I have seen many movies and this is definitely one of the BEST movies I have ever seen. I loved it from the very opening to the end. It was like seeing a real MMA fight. I was really impressed of the action and acting. It has been very long since I got so emotional in a movie. The music, the story and the acting was very very good. I recommend this to everyone! Cant believe I actually missed this at the Movies. Cant even remember seeing advert or trailer for it. Why has not it gotten any more attention?See! You wont regret it! =)

Having just watched this film I feel it is necessary for me to do a review of this straight away.Brutal, tense, emotional, meaningful. It tugs at the heartstrings like very few movies this one, there is one fight in particular which I will not spoil but it's by far one of the most intense, vicious fights I have ever seen on screen. The way in which it is filmed is fantastic and really adds to the emotional impact. By the end of it I found myself dripping in sweat and on the verge of tears - incredible.This film is exactly what it sets out to be and more. It's dramatic and it's action packed. It's impressive without being cheesy and in my eyes is an absolute triumph.

Positives:the acting of the main 3 is brilliant, especially that of Hardy and Nolte. The scene where Nolte's character relapses is just astonishing.the Fight scenes are (for the most part) brilliant. Apart from a few unrealistic moves by "Koba" and the lack of blood, must be the most realistic MMA film-having actual MMA trained fighters involved in the film really worked
-the premise is very good and does succeed, again for the most part, in making a convoluted plot somewhat realistic.Negatives:
Joel Edgertons character is a bit of a rip off of Walter White from Breaking BadWhy did Koba wear Soviet Union apparel when it's set in present day? That's just lazy fan service and took me right out of the film.did Tommy Conlin get arrested after the fight; why would he after all his friends were killed by friendly fire?that military story was not delved into nearly enoughthat it came out that they were brothers minutes before their fight is just stupidOverall, a good film that will be remembered for some very memorable sequences and some even more memorable acting.Let down by some poor, lazy choices and I can't help but feel like it was so close to being so much better, with just some minor changes

Review title: Family conflicts are not easy to overcome.
Review_body: Loved this movie. Tom Hardy is off the charts with this one. Worth the time for sure. I was equally impressed with the character of the the father, Nick Nolte. His own struggles with alcohol, the war, the family troubles and the distance created by all of it. The military aspect didn't quite tell a tale there and was far from accurate in legalities but the ideal affect was achieved, the government always reclaims what is theirs according to them. The script writing was a bit sluggish, like pulling teeth at times. I don't care for missed opportunities to say what should be said in any situation. When I write, nothing is left hanging unless it has to be. I believe in writing of true human emotion and not Hollywood style where you have conversation with huge emotional impact but never say all that should be said. Mostly, the human race is not like that. We feel it, we say it. This movie tends to leave too much hanging in the air. Thick pains of oppressed emotions. Still love the movie though.

I first watched this movie on Netflix and didn't really know what to expect as I hadn't looked at any reviews beforehand. After watching it, I went on to buy it for only £3 (Which is a bargain). It starts off a little slow but it was definitely worth it in the end. What I mainly liked about this movie, is that it has a lot of background information to the main characters, which really makes them interesting and most importantly memorable. When it gets going, its almost impossible to move your eyes away from the screen as it keeps you gripped at all times. This is partially because anything could happen at any given moment. I simply cant see how people can give bad reviews for this masterpiece. The makers have done a really good job by creating a truly outstanding movie. I strongly recommend to anybody who hasn't already seen it because for only £3, its a crime not to.

Review title: Despite no interest in MMA - my personal favourite
Review_body: This movie will tear you apart and put you back brick by brick. It's incredibly intense, raw, and above all beautiful. The relationship between the main characters, their own personal fights that they take into the cage... Astounding. Just rewatched it and I still cannot believe what an incredible adventure this movie is each time you see it. Acting, music, camare angles... Incredible.

Review title: Great movie with great performance from Joel & Tom
Review_body: Loved the plot of the movie. The performances from Joel Edgerton and Tom Hardy are really great. They both show the love real brothers will share in real life. One fighting for saving of his family (daughter and the house) and the other one to give the money to his best (dead) friend's wife. Tom Hardy really looked like a MMA fighter in this movie. He was bulky and strong and looked as if he can really kick some serious stuff. Joel on the other hand looks perfectly like a professor with a family. The ending scene kind of made me cry where Joel just lifted up Tom and started walking out of the ring without caring for the officials or anyone else.

Sometimes I feel I need to write a review to right a wrong. This is one of those times. I believe that this is one of the greatest films of all time The writing, the acting, the directing, the photography, the score, and the editing were all of the highest caliber. It is wrong that this film did not win several Oscars. Apart from the injustice done to all who made it, the lack of Oscar recognition is a tragic missed opportunity to encourage thoughtful, deep, deeply artistic, and deeply moving film-making. When I think of all the millions spent on truly stupid films and then think of Warrior, my heart hurts. I would like to say something directly to those who collaborated on this masterpiece: I thank you with all my heart for this beautiful and moving work of art. I hope that you will not be discouraged by the lack of proper recognition for what you did, and that you will make more films of this quality.

Warrior is directed by Gavin O'Connor and stars Tom Hardy and Joel Edgerton. This movie is about two brothers that both have experience with fighting and my god was this movie good. The thing that makes this movie so great are the characters, they are interesting, deep and you get what they are coming from.I especially enjoyed watching Tom Hardy's character, when he's on the scene you can see his fire, especially in the fighting scenes. You can see that his character has been through a lot and he takes all of his anger out on people he's fighting against and it was very well acted by Tom Hardy.Joel Edgerton was also very good in this movie, i'm actually a big fan of his movies and I thought him and Hardy were both excellent in this movie. It is also a very stunning looking film, sometimes during the fighting scenes the camera would shake a lot so it was kind of hard sometimes to see what's going on but other than that it's a fantastic movie. The ending of this movie was very good and sad for me. It had that feeling of brothers in the end always love each other and care for each other which was very deep for me.

When I first watched this movie, I had no idea about MMA or UFC fighting. I thoroughly enjoyed the movie and made me fell into love with MMA sport. This movie keeps you engaging with family drama and ground-and-pound MMA fighting scenes. If you are fan of MMA, you will definitely love this movie from your heart. Background score by Mark Isham is excellent. Beautifully crafted fighting shots with heart racing soundtrack will definitely make a great spectacle of your lifetime. Thousand times better and realistic fighting drama than Rockey series. Go for it!!
Good Action, Best acting with awesome cast. Bit predictable but loved ending. The story is superficial compared to strength of characters. Good to see upcoming star and you know who I mean.

Spoiler Alert Movie Synopsis:Man who makes poor financial planning decisions steps on his own military veteran brother's neck to pay a mortgage. Also his veteran brother was fighting to support a war widow.
One of the best movie of all time!!! Tom Hardy at is best.

Review title: This is not a movie about fighting - it's about love and forgiving
Review_body: I just watched this movie for the fifth time in 8 years. What is clear to me is, that this is not about fighting or winning. This is a movie about love. Love between brothers and forgiveness to their alcoholic father who failed them over and over again. What is so impressive to me is that none of the three guys in the movie (Hardy, Edgerton, Nolte) seems to know a way to show their deep love to any of the others. They are wearing this "fighter person suit" (Hardy especially. brilliant) but are also able to show us the vulnerable child that was left behind. I thought it is only me but when I showed this gem of a film to my niece, who is a big movie fan and was only 18 years old at the time (I should mention she has also two brothers), I could observe my own first reaction to it multiplied by ten: she was crying so hard in the end (and also in between) that we needed to comfort her. After calming down she told us that this was one of the most beautiful movies she has ever seen (and who am I to contradict her).

Review title: MMA fans around the world rejoice! This is your movie!
Review_body: Whoa, this was terrible! Full of clichés, agonizingly boring. Be warned: only MMA fans will enjoy this.I read that some people are comparing this to Rocky, that is a laugh. Rocky keeps you going with a strong and well paced story, this is unfortunately laden full of clichéd seen before boredom, usually the kind you find in Steven Segal movies.Nick Nolte was the only redeeming character in this movie, his performance was fine, but not Oscar worthy. The rest of the cast is just so boring.If you're an MMA fan watch it, otherwise steer clear of this snooze fest.The 8.3 rating is very deceiving, the votes are most definitely from MMA fans.2/10

The youngest son of an alcoholic former boxer returns home, where he's trained by his father for competition in a mixed martial arts tournament - a path that puts the fighter on a collision course with his estranged, older brother.

I tried to like this movie-- I really did. After all, I am into kickboxing and have tremendously enjoyed the fight/drama genre in the past. But if you are a fighter yourself, you probably won't enjoy this movie much, either. The fight scenes consisted of mostly repetitive moves and those ended way too quickly for the most part. Tom Hardy's acting was extremely unbelievable, in my opinion, and I couldn't connect with his character emotionally; what is up with the teenage boy attitude? His brother's behavior, too, was not very convincing: one minute he is this nice lovable teacher, and the next he is an arrogant SOB who is very picky about whom he chooses to love and forgive. Overall, it was a far-fetched and unoriginal story.Sorry, IMDb. I can no longer trust your ratings!

WOW YES JUST WOW! First of all very realistic!! Good clean fights. No overdoing there. Much in respect as this sport is suppose to be! Some current fighters can learn from this. All the rest of the story is just right. Also no overdoing, no seeking for extra drama or sympathy, just right on. 100% Top!
This is in all a very good produced movie. Real raw life right on how it is or can be (for some). Weither you don't really like boxing or MMA, if you can respect sports and athletes in general I think you can still like LOVE this movie. Nick Nolte what a joy and perfect part he played. Them 3 are super-casted!!!
This movie is the perfect example of a Second Chance, and that people are willing to change and forgive. Family is the most important thing in the World and always worth fighting for!

I just wanted to say that I read the negative comments and I was thinking to each and every one of them: 'Have you been asleep the entire movie?' Do not read any nonsense bad reviewers say about this movie. I watched it for like the sixth time just now and it still grabbed me by the neck from start to finish. Great acting, great story, great ending.And for the haters, of course the brothers end up in the final?? I mean what kind of nonsense would it be otherwise? Its the explosion of the emotion of the entire movie at the end. This was a masterpiece.

Review title: see it, you won't be disappointed
Review_body: Actually, when i planned on seeing the movie, i thought it would be another fighting movie about a guy, with a questionable history, who has issues with another guy, while dealing with a girl. And when you strip it down to the basics, it is exactly like that. But then you realize that the main storyline is the one about 'the other guy', and that is his brother. The acting is good, way above average. But i do have a problem with the way Tom Hardy is shown in the movie. His behavior and fighting style suggests that he is a barbarian, with an IQ below 50. Maybe it was the directors' vision, but i would have done it slightly different. Nick Nolte is amazing. He deserves a good role like this, a chance he gets not often enough. Frank Grillo and Joel Edgerton do a great job. And then, the fighting itself: it's more than just a fighting movie. I can read in the other reviews that comparisons with Rocky are often made. They are both good films in the genre. Rocky is a huge icon in movie history, known to man and child for over 35 years. But it's more a 'drama' than a 'fighting movie'. Warrior (for me) tilts the balance a bit in the other direction. The difference and variation in fighting styles of the contenders is welcome. Joel (Brendan) has clearly a another approach in the cage. I enjoyed it, no doubt about it. Nevertheless, a huge merit for director, producer and actors: one of the best movies i've seen in a while. Go and see it (or rent it)!

Review title: The greatest MMA movie ever made
Review_body: Comes from the most simple of concepts! But includes the emotions that come with trying to be the best and a parallel storyline of the two brothers. Loved the use of jiu jitsu and acting and this movie wasn't far off a 10/10 but lost the point on making Dan a bit too strong to the point where you think Brandon would have no chance.Everything else about this movie yells that it is and should always be a classic I will rewatch and have also purchased.

YES, WOOOW! that would be enough said. By watching the trailer I thought it to be a pretty decent fighting movie, but HOW wrong was I.. As previous speakers have said, the fight only adds extra entertainment to the plot itself.. At first I got the feeling of a typical Hollywood movie, and we all know how that ends up.. This was a total different story, emotional yet entertaining on an whole other level.. Amazing acting from everyone involved, it felt real from beginning to end.. Maybe it is just a right after feeling but I would rate this extremely high on my personal list, prob top 10. Got everything I can ask for in a movie.. I love fighting movies and, again, this one brings even more to the plate.. MIND BLOWING! EASILY 10/10

This movie turned out to be more than what I expected. There is a Rocky-Esq feel but in no way does it hinder the movie. The acting was great, Tom Hardy I personally feel had an Oscar worthy performance. Joel most likely had a breakthrough for his career, he was great. Nick Nolte stole nearly every scene, he deserves an Oscar nomination.The fight scenes were well done and entertaining, but it was the solid performances and story behind the characters that made Warrior special. Its emotional, entertaining, and inspiring. You truly feel for the characters.Honestly, I would highly recommend. The box office numbers are surprisingly low but with time, i feel, this movie is going to catch on. I'd say it is arguably one of the years best. (Knowing the two brothers face off does not in any way ruin the movie, its a must-see).

I had the pleasure of seeing Warrior at 2011 CinemaCon, walking in not knowing a thing about the movie, other than it was a movie about 'fighting.' And though a MMA movie (Mixed Martial Arts), not boxing, per se, for the genre, fighting, Warrior delivers a much better story than The Fighter, and is on par with Clint Eastwood's Oscar winner, Million Dollar Baby.Expect a Best Supporting Actor Oscar nod in 2012 for Nick Nolte. And superstar status for Tom Hardy.Warrior, though a work of fiction, plays out like a true story; two brothers at odds with each other and their father, in the town of Pittsburgh, who resort to prize fighting, one for the money, the other to prove himself a man.

I gave it a vote of 4 because I've seen this stuff before. This movie wasn't something you could consider a fighting movie, because the action is short and not shown.This is a movie where the main character is trying to earn money by fighting in a ring. Thrill, action and suspense have been replaced by drama.The plot is the fighter's relationship with his original family. And I don't think people who like drama will ever watch a boxing movie. There is no background provided for the people he's fighting. Our hero just goes and pummels his opponents and you're supposed to be impressed. This is an uninteresting movie. No thought was given to his opponents.This is just about a poor guy trying to get money for his family, while resolving his issues with his father. Even the fight scenes are pitiful, you can't really see anything as far as the action goes.I can't believe the IMDb score made me watch this crap. It's a drama. As anything else, it misses all points.

Review title: If you don't like fighting... watch it anyway!
Review_body: I don't like ultimate fighting, I don't even like boxing. I put off watching this movie for that same reason for some time, even though it comes highly recommended.Finally I decided to give it a chance and was hooked after about 10 minutes. Nick Nolte plays superb, in my opinion. He is an amazing actor, and gives great atmosphere in the scenes he does.I only knew the two actors playing the brothers very little, but they come across very true to their roles, very believable.For the first time in many, many years I was, literally, sitting on the edge of the couch, almost rooting for the guys when they were fighting. And I am not even into sports! Enjoy!

One the worst films a saw in while - and that goes especially for the screenplay. The only reasons for holding up until the end were the fight scenes. And even they became so unreal and the end. The plot was definitely not worth the book it was written on. War hero, Russian bad guy, school teacher MMA world champion ??? A broke war veteran, without PST, who will donate his prize money to the widow of his war buddy? The writers had totally NO idea where the story was supposed to be going to. Fragments of anonymous family biographies, desperately linked up to produce a script. This quality is even worse than a beginners failure... sorry

Saw this film at Glasgow cineworld with the gf. I'd previously been impressed with Tom hardy in "Martina Cole's The Take", "Inception" and "Bronson" to name a few. Even as far back as his small stint on "Band of Brothers" TV series. Love watching and training in MMA, so was excited upon hearing this film was coming about. Was hoping & praying this would NOT be a "Rocky" with MMA and found myself completely blown out the water by the emotional depth of the characters, (provided by Hardy, Edgerton & Nolte), and the honest acting. Great story, fantastic acting, humorous in parts throughout and beautiful direction! We both loved it, told our friends about it........C'mon the DVD! :) Nolte should get an Oscar nod. Hope this review helped.

Review title: Much more than a boxing movie....
Review_body: I thought the movie would be like a usual boxing movie.....where, a previous champ now an underdog returns back to fight due to some out of hand complicated situation, which can only be solved by winning the championship or fight....The movie is much more than just boxing. It is story about a family. It is a story about a father and a son. It is a story about two brothers. There are so many emotions, that you are unable to take sides and sympathize with all the characters.I have to say both the lead actors Joel Edgerton and Tom Hardy acted superbly. They were perfect for their roles.Definitely worth a watch!

Review title: Nothing awesome as being projected here
Review_body: Common man...... how this is rated as one of the best I really don't understand. Yes... movies are not rated by looking at the climax. But the director completely lost it in the end. The match was clearly a fixed one. Tommy lost it for the sake of his father and brother. It is clearly visible dude. And what was his father doing in a taxi in the end (out of the stadium) and he was back in the end....there is no meaning you dumb A**. It looks like director was throwing away like giving the audience some thing 'UNEXPECTED'. I am watching the MMA since years. Most dumbest thing was the makeup. Who is the idiot (makeup artist). Did he ever saw any of the boxing or sports movies...!!! Look at the ROCKY movies dude and learn some thing from them. makeup was so unreal. Any one who will be the head of MMA will never award the 5M to the winner of that match. But in the end it was nothing but Bull S#!t. I was actually ready to rate this movie 9/10 before watching it. But after watching I thought 6 is more than enough. I don't understand why makers of the movies think that always making something different would satisfy the viewer. Anyway's Tom hardy was awesome and brilliant with his high energy performance. This movie was almost a letdown.

First of all, this movie is extremely well made. This is without a doubt my favorite film of this year, my favorite sports film, and probably one of my favorite movies of all time. And all this is after only one viewing, which is going to change dramatically in the very near future.The acting is top notch in Warrior. Joel Edgerton did a great job with his role, and I genuinely felt for the character and his family. Nick Nolte was outstanding in his role as the father of the two main characters. His character's problems and the way acted towards his sons is very well done and realistic on his part. There are some dramatic scenes of his that really make you feel sorry for him, and you feel sorry for his family too because of what he has done to them in the past.Tom Hardy, however, was the best part of this movie acting-wise. He took the stereotypical "tough guy who doesn't need anyone or want anyone" and made him very relatable. He still plays that kind of character, but he is so much more than that, and I felt for him in almost every scene he was in, regardless of his actions, because you just have that feeling that he has had a very rough life. I got goosebumps numerous times throughout the movie due to his amazing acting.The editing and cinematography was fantastic as well. My favorite showing of this aspect is when they show a montage of people training. It sounds like it has been done before, but the way it was done was...well, you'd have to see it to know what I mean.Going into it, I knew that this movie would be at the very least good, but it was amazing. I would not be surprised to see Hardy and Nolte get acting nominations at the Oscars, and I think they both have a great chance of winning. Best editing, picture, and screenplay awards are also very possible for this dramatic, heart wrenching, amazing film.

This is the first and last time that i'm writing in IMDb.Nothing to say, words can't tell the emotions and feelings that such a masterpiece like this movie bring to me. Like Ben Hur, Godfather, Amarcord and so many others.I'm not a fan of MMC-UFC, i'm a true lover of Cinema. And this my friends, is Art. Real cinema. Pure art.Tears and applause together. The best combination.Congratulations to all the people who made this movie.Go see it. P.S. > One of the best acting, directing and writing i've ever seen in history of Hollywood.

From hatred and apathy to forgiveness and re-unity, the feeling of Tommy carried the audience through every conversation and body language with Dad and Brendon. They "were" a family, and in the end, they finally became a family again.Dad was great in that he was remorseful and trying to make up for what he did, but like Tommy said, "What was done was done. You couldn't change that." Dad later collapsed but the tension with Tommy eased after that.As for Brendon, he showed responsibility at the brink of bankruptcy, the heart of a champion and the care for his family.The movie ended in a very good way, and with all the fight scene and conflicts between the three main characters would stick every moviegoers till the last scene.

Review title: Wonderful movie on so many levels!
Review_body: My family and I just watched this movie and I had to join IMDb just to write this review. After seeing a review about this movie on NPR, I put it on the list of movies my husband & I wanted to watch. Even with that good review, I wasn't sure what to expect: Rocky, Fighter, etc. It's a long movie, over 2 hours, and the fighting doesn't really start to happen till over half way through but that may be the best part about it. Because the fight wouldn't mean anything without knowing the history of these men. This movie moved me to tears, it made me cheer, it made me nervous for the fighters, it made me want them to win and it made me want them to heal. I can't articulate how well made I feel the movie is but if you have any urge to see it, watch it! Just go watch it.

Beautiful, heart-warming, tear-jerking, exciting, EMOTIONAL, uplifting.I can honestly not say enough good things about Warrior. Starring Joel Edgerton, Tom Hardy and Nick Nolte, Warrior is a film about fighting! Edgerton and Hardy (brothers) and Nolte (father) are all fighting for something different. Edgerton is the older brother, fighting to keep his family's home from being foreclosed on by the bank. He's a good, not great fighter with tons of heart. You can't help but root for him as he fills the protypical "underdog" and moral lead of the movie. Hardy the younger brother of the two and the superior skilled fighter is fighting his demons. He is conflicted internally and hurting bad from painful experiences in his life. Hardy deals with the pain the only way he knows how - Fighting. You can't help but to feel empathize with Hardy's character. Nolte the alcoholic father is fighting to stay sober and fighting to win a place back in his sons lives after years of abuse and neglect. The constant rejection he receives from his sons as he attempts to re-establish relationships will have you sympathizing with his character from the very first scene. Nolte's acting chops are very evident and there is a scene with him that will bring a tear to the eye of even the most stoic of viewers. Both brothers who haven't spoken in a decade, through an ironic twist of fate, end up in an MMA tournament where the winner takes home 3 million dollars and the title of Worlds Best Middle-Weight. The film shifts from perspective to perspective of each character and has you rooting for all three. And even though only 1 fighter can win the actual tournament, all three men find a way to win the fight that they need the most. For Edgerton it's money and respect, for Hardy it's peace with himself and his estranged family, and for Nolte it's alcoholism and to get back in the graces of his sons lives. Brilliantly executed. If your not crying at the end there is something seriously wrong with you!!

I watched this movie for Tom Hardy, and his performance was excellent as per usual, so I am being generous in my rating of 7 because of this because it should be more like a 5 or 6. It was just too clichéd. The story was OK, I liked the whole idea of the physics teacher moonlighting in MMA, but it seemed to stretch reality at some points in a film that is trying to be serious. There could of been a few more scenes to the story to add more dimension and give more depth to the characters relationships so it wasn't so clichéd (I think it could be more moving in the end if it had done this - seriously at the end I knew I was supposed to be moved but I wasn't). For example the Dad did some bad stuff, but what exactly, why did they leave? What was the brothers relationship like before all the crap went down? Etc. I am a viewer that definitely doesn't need everything spelled out, and I like when films leave some mystery, but there wasn't enough here to emotionally invest me. And when the film does reveal a hidden secret I was kind of disappointed, it went for the obvious at every turn, The performances in this movie are great, especially Nolte and Hardy, and that is what the film relies on to get our sympathies. With different actors the film would have really not been that good, so I would give the director/story and all other aspects of this film a 5, the acting around an 8, again I am being generous with a 7 rating. It is definitely worth watching, and entertaining, but anyone with half a brain will know what is going to happen in the end half way through the movie, and will even know the plot surprises before they are revealed, because the film goes for the obvious.

"Let me explain something to you: the only thing I have in common with Brendan Conlon is that we have absolutely no use for you." Warrior is brutal, emotional, and touching experience of family drama concept. In the bandage of sports and enjoyable powerful drama, it's very hard to resist this one. Joel Edgerton and Tom Hardy gives an depth emotional and sympathy accordance to each characters background. Dazzling cinematography also from Masanobu Takayanagi, which successfully grab the feel and elegant fighting sequence.Gavin O'Connor finally got his masterpiece, it's funny when he decide to come out from behind the camera. OK, Warrior is 2011's heart stirring spectacle that you've to see anytime, anywhere, and any circumstances. Strongly recommended!!

the movies u watch can either be a good or a bad movie.. if it is a good movie u learn what makes the movie good. if it is bad u learn what should have been done to make it good. and definitely this movie tells u something. here it is.. even though the movie is predictable to some extent from the beginning it never let u feel bored. the reason is the director worked on the details. from the performance of paddy conlon character done by nick nolte to the characterization of tough guy tom hardy keeping his character so composed. he made sure that there isn't a moment that keeps audience's attention out of the movie. thats a definite 8/10.

Review title: Don't they check sound quality before releasing?
Review_body: Slow, plodding, could not connect with any of the characters. If anyone can explain why someone accidentally threw a blanket over the microphone, it might help explain the muffled conversations throughout half of the movie. For dramatic effect it was a definite fail. Withoout giving anything away, I really miss the Rocky movies after seeing this 'must miss'. One of the things that really irritates is when filmmakers thrust the microphone right in the thick of special effects and seemingly completely remove it during vital conversations. It implies that the audience suffers from a complete lack of imagination on their own and deem it necessary to supply it for them through loud special effects. I don't recommend this movie to anyone who wishes to be entertained for 2+ hours.

I haven't written any review till now (and probably I won't do it from now on) but this movie intrigued me enough to make me write this. First of all, a definition: cliché: a trite, stereotyped expression; a sentence or phrase, usually expressing a popular or common thought or idea, that has lost originality, ingenuity, and impact by long overuse. Second, my claim: this movie is a festival of clichés. I will argue in support of this claim:1) the broken family cliché: common man! I saw this one over and over again!2) the beautiful family cliché: nice smart husband (he's a teacher), good looking wife, two cute kids3) the evil system cliché: a) banks are bad guys, b) the scene where Tommy and his friend signaled their presence but the American army did nothing to save them - soldiers are good, armies are bad, c) Brendan is suspended till the end of the semester. 4) the good cause cliché: fighters are not just violent and vain ... they need to fight for something bigger than them. Brendan for his family, Tommy for his friend's widow. this is so much as those TV shows where lots of social cases are presented to the public and they sing, dance or whatever ... and they all represent a good cause and everybody cries and so on. 5) the bad guy cliché: this was actually the trigger for my review. After more than 20 years since the ending of the Cold War, the director thought that the bad guy must be a Russian (with no Russian traits whatsoever). This is not all! :)) Koba has a red communist T-short! common man! this is hilarious! and the Russian patriotic song!? :)) (lukilly it wasn't Katiusha) the second bad guy is the gym guy. (he beats a spare partner)6) the spiritual training cliché: this is a variation of the fast-food yoga cliché (many martial arts movies present this cliché) yeah Beethoven is nice but really ... conlons are fighters not dalai lamas!7) the lucky coincidence cliché: Marco Santos broke his leg and Brendan is there to replace him. I saw this move so many times ...8) the slow hard working turtle cliché: your lack of skills is not important! you only need to work hard and have a moral purpose. You will beat anybody! :)) this is related here with the underdog cliché and to the age in sport is like age in wines-the older, the better. I mean if Stalone/Rocky did it and they were like 60 years old ... Brendan could do it too!9) the gangsta education cliché: this has two parts: first, American high-school students are usually pictured (in American movies) like not that smart (but cool) punks. Second, the teacher is also cool but smart enough to teach a gangsta version of physics (Newton in this case). I don't know much about US education system .. but physics implies math and in senior classes you can't teach stuff that easy! anyway this is a cliché because I saw it in lots of American movies.10) the resenting wife cliché: this is about every wife in any boxing/martial arts movie .. first she is frightened then she become a supporter ...11) the danger of death cliché: these movies grossly exaggerate the danger of practicing a sport. I mean OK is not chess, they usually get hurt but really, it is a sport, there are rules and actually driving is statistically more dangerous than practicing MMA.12) the brothers cliché: way too many brothers in boxing/martial arts movies. you can't be a boxer if you are the only child!:)) the final scene is ...
