(I won't describe it here) sooooo much like Latin American soap operas. I MEAN .. REALLY! so from these 12 points ... yes, I think that the movie is a festival of clichés and that's not a coincidence. (can't prove this but I have a feeling). If you want to sell something ... there are at least two ways: you can sale the future in the present (mainly Apple's strategy) or you can sell emotional clichés. This movie (I think) is on the second class. It sells emotions that ordinary people usually experience. everything is simple and focused on the viewer's emotion not on his/her reason. we are all brothers, sons, we all have wifes, kids, we all have problems with the system ... the only difference is that in movies we can actually win:)) and that's why we buy this movie. We win here. in itself, the movie is not as pathetic as I described it (Nolte actually did a decent job and the Moby Dick stuff might be a nice idea). The pathetic part is the huge amount of stars it received. the only thing that's missing from this picture is an Oscar for Tom Hardy or for his more pathetic brother-character, Brendan/Joel!

I'm a great fan of sports, but I've seen a movie with sports genre, that's because I prefer sports as it is - real, full of passion and emoticons. In my opinion sports and movies just don't go together. Both should be kept apart.Anyway after a lot of recommendation by friends, I decided to give this a go, and boy oh boy how wrong was I! This was easily the best movie that came out last year. After watching this I've decided to give "The Fighter" a go too. And any more recommendations for sports' movies are welcome too.Anyway here goes the actual review... Hmmm, so where to start... This movie breaks out as completely unique and very moving. The story really takes you on a emotional roller-coaster. It immerses yourself into the movie and you can almost feel all the tension that runs between the characters. The MMA sequences definitely are on-the-edge-of-your-seat stuff and gives you goosebumps. Tom Hardy, Nick Nolte and Joel Edgerton, I would love to see these guys get rewarded for their brilliant acting performances. The performances are uniformly excellent, and the writing and direction by Gavin O'Connor is concise and real. If you haven't watched it go and watch it, you will definitely enjoy the ride.9.5/10

Review title: A tricky Hollywood ripoff the Korean Classic Crying Fist
Review_body: I'm only giving it 5 because of the good actings and some visual work....story-wise, it was a very cheap Hollywood version of the Korean movie "Crying Fist"(2005), which, however is a far better movie story- line and direction wise. The single-cut boxing round shot during the last fight of that Korean movie is easily one of the best fight choreographies ever done. and yet IMDb gives that a much lower rating than this one!! But how come not single person mentioning this here?! All you Hollywood junkies...get out there and watch some real deal before calling THIS the best boxing movie ever..... Tom Hardy was good...nick was awesome....but the movie was very slow at times and kind of predictable since the very beginning...it was a movie about throwing punches that lacks the PUNCH itself....on the other hand, two rookies suddenly starting to beat up world's top ranked MMA fighters is just too much to digest, and kind of an insult to the sport itself! and i'm not even talking about the plot- holes...watch "Crying Fist"instead and you'll see how characters can be built.

Review title: Great cast! Slow beginning! Good action! Perfect ending!
Review_body: For some reason - and I do still not know why exactly - this movie was not released in cinemas here in Germany but is only available on DVD and Blu-ray which is in my opinion a huge pity. It is a great, a really great movie that, as far as I can tell nearly has everything a great and dramatic movie needs. And yes it is a great and dramatic movie, Maybe not actually a drama but certainly it is not what the German publishers must've thought it is: Just another martial arts fighting movie! It's not at all. Of course they fight in the movie and admittedly it is very well done so they must've put some thought into it but in general it is about the relationship of the two brothers and also their father.ACTION Scince the movie shows actors performing martial arts (and not vice versa) it is even more impressive that the fighting sequences are so very entertaining. Also they are not overloaded with slow motion sequences like i.e. Guy Ritchie's 'Sherlock Holmes'.CAST Great actors actually performing great acting. Nick Nolte ahead of all others grumbling madly and rather impressively, Tom Hardy especially in the end with both superb acting and fighting and Joel Edgerton as a financially struggling physics teacher (Both astonishingly good as a teacher and loving but troubled husband and also as a ex-fighter trying to get back into the game).SOUNDTRACK Great soundtrack from Beethoven's ninth symphony to a great final song giving the ending the perfect touch. PLOT Well thought out plot story convincingly telling the story of those two brothers and their seriously compromised relationship. FLAWS (SPOILERS) Aside from the (at first) too slowly told story (which later picks up speed after all) I can only report the minor that the back story of Tommy Conlon regarding his past with the army and him deserting his unit, while saving a couple of other soldiers from a drowning tank fairly unconnected to the rest of the movie. I watched the movie twice now and I am still not really seeing the actual connection to both the plot in general and the emotional past. GENERAL But all in all a very good and partially very touching movie with an amazing and emotional end.

This movie has a great story that will keep you intrigued throughout the entire length. The actors Tom Hardy and Joel Edgerton each lead separate captivating stories as the brothers and Nick Nolte brings it home as the once abandoned, aloof, and drunken father trying to find a way back into the lives of the men. Admittedly, I was wary of this movie because it has what I believe is a predictable ending which is the only downfall but the drama kept the movie alive nevertheless. This movie will definitely be included in my list of movie favorites and I just found two new favorite actors as well. Lastly, I feel that it's important to note that yes this movie does have a character bias which brings it down a point for me along with it's cut-off style ending but all in all an 8 out of 10.

Review title: It is these kinds of films that make us like the Hollywood so much.
Review_body: Warrior is an action-drama centered around Tommy (Hardy) and Brendan Conlon (Edgerton) who get into a multi martial art fighting tournament called Sparta. The film is directed by Gavin O'Connor and stars Tom Hardy, Joel Edgerton along with Academy Award nominee Nick Nolte, Frank Grillo and Jennifer Morrison.Pros :A very overdone plot - where a guy fights to save his family and the ones that he cares about -was very well presented. The story wouldn't have been able to attract the crowds if it wasn't handled well. The story was well built and had a perfect balance of drama and action as it slowly moved from the family life to the tournament. The whole second half was full of nail biting fights in the championship along with peoples' reactions and expectations. The writer gave proper attention to the characters giving details of their backgrounds that ultimately gives them the motive to be a part of the tournament. A Russian fighter named Koba, played by Kurt Angle, was introduced. He never lost any fight and was proposed to win the championship. As an audience you know that he won't but you are anxious to know which out of the two Tommy and Brendan is going to fight him. Once that question is answered, there is a bigger one for you. Who will win? You as a viewer don't want to answer that, because not only it is hard for you to decide but also difficult for you to pick your favorite. The director had so cleverly introduced the protagonists and narrated their stories that it is simply impossible to choose. The action director must be credited for all the fight sequences as both the protagonists had their own way of fighting which was completely different from the other. The climax was unexpected and appropriate. I really like endings that don't have a montage at the end saying 'and they all lived happily ever after'. I like films that cut as soon as the conflict is resolved. The dialogs were carefully written and placed to reduce the pressure on the viewers that is building continuously. They will definitely bring a little smile on your face. You can read a few of these here. The movie was very well directed, giving no space for any kind of loopholes or continuity errors. I was waiting if there is an error in the movement when the camera switched to different angles, but I couldn't find any. From my experience I can say that the pre-production was really strong. The director knew exactly what he wanted and hence even minute details like stubble, random messages on the gym white board etc. were taken care of. The art department did a nice job taking care of the different looks of gyms, classrooms and of course that of the tournament. The cinematography was had something new. There was a very slow shift of focus from one subject to another in various scenes, which I felt was nice. There were some POVs in the fight sequences that looked brilliant. It appeared as if the hands came out of the camera and hit the fighter. The actors did full justice to their roles, the efforts in bringing out the appropriate look was seen. Cons:I loved the movie completely. I am not going to say anything here just for the heck of writing something.The Verdict :Tom Hardy already has movies like Inception, Rocknrolla and awaited The Dark Knight rises in his credential and Warrior is an edition in the same. The movie will definitely bring Joel Edgerton to the limelight and we expect to see him in good projects in the future. This is one of the best films that of 2011. It's a Must watch for guys and girls if you find no reason to watch it, just go for Tom Hardy. Acting and Cast : 9/10 Script : 9/10 Direction : 9.5/10 Cinematography : 8.5/10 Editing : 9/10OVERALL RATING : 9.5/10It is these kinds of films that make us like the Hollywood so much.

Review title: Fantastic sports drama with an outstanding performance of the actors!
Review_body: First of all I must apologize for my bad English...but now to the movie:"Warrior" is definitely one of the best films in 2011! A sports drama in a class of its own! This film has just everything: feelings and emotions, suspense, action and a terrific acting performance of the three main characters Tom Hardy, Joel Edgerton and Nick Nolte.The story is from beginning to end very poignant and captivating. The troubled past in the family and the current problems of the three main characters are represented by an almost perfect actor's performance from the beginning and are communicated in a very emotional way.As a counterpart to the many poignant dialogues of family problems, the very successful fight scenes also convince because of their realistic representation which is often not the case in many other boxing films.Right from the beginning, it is clear that this is not about a meaningless sting of fight scenes! The emotional story and its development up to a dream end is definitely in the foreground. All this is just refined with this emotional and realistic fight scenes.All in all you can say that you find a perfect mixture of drama and action - just what constitutes a successful sports drama - in this movie. Anyone who sees this film will be enthusiastic about the great story and will remember this movie for a long time. Therefore, i cant understand why this film is so unknown and so few people have heard of it.Conclusion: "Warrior" is a movie you must see! 10/10!

WARRIORWARRIOR packs a surprising punch! Despite its apparent disinterest in avoiding the predictable and generic formula of an underdog's rise to fame/victory, it contains an unexpected depth that in return raises the film far above others of its kind. The narrative skillfully crafts us into a tense family drama. Our curiosity is satisfied as we are drawn into the history of the main characters. The film presents an alcoholic father (Nick Nolte) who has been sober for a thousand days. He has two sons, Brendan (Joel Edgerton) and Tommy (Tom Hardy) who have not seen him or each other for years. Brendan has minimal contact with his Father, strictly by phone or mail. Despite being brought up in a household that suffered the effects of alcoholism he has made a success of himself. He has a wife and two young daughters. He became a Physics teacher, moving away from fighting for a living following a hospital scare. Regardless of his best efforts, life still throws him a curve ball and he struggles financially due to medical costs amounted by one of his daughters during recovery from a serious illness. He is left with an ultimatum, find extra money from somewhere quick or forfeit his family home.Tommy became estranged to his father and brother having chosen to follow his mother after the break down of his parents' marriage. Time passes and their mother suffers an uncomfortable death, unable to afford hospital treatment due to a lack of insurance. Tommy joins the Marines to make a new life. This fell apart when his entire unit was killed as a result of friendly fire. Left as the only survivor, Tommy vowed to look after the wife and children of his closest friend who died along with the rest of the unit. There is a clear parallel between the two brothers. Their turbulent childhood had a knock on effect making them stronger and braver than they might otherwise have been. Their individual and collective hardships helped shape their nature towards facing difficulties, to fight, to become warriors.I think one of the reasons this film stands out from the crowd is because despite it's borderline incredible journey of two estranged brothers who enter a $5 million prize, winner takes all, mixed martial arts competition there still remains a great believability and understanding with regard to the brothers' dilemmas, difficulties and to the complex nature of their family's history and relationship towards one another.Family feuds, financial difficulties, illness, loss, substance abuse, War, are all common issues within society. By supplementing these themes into the characters story arc the narrative creates an extra powerful new dimension that many viewers can relate to in some way. Life isn't always fair and to quote Forest Gump, it is like a box of chocolates, you never no what your going to get and regardless of your best efforts sometimes you might find yourself in hot water with your back up against the wall. We can therefore empathise with the two brothers and their troubles and be encouraged by their non-defeatist attitude.Nolte's performance is exceptional. Far from two dimensional, his character has great depth and realism highlighting a reality that is far from black and white. Having rid himself of an alcohol dependency, he now seeks redemption following a cold reunion with his youngest son, Tommy. His uncomfortable, mixed mannerisms display a broken man thrilled to see his sons again in the spotlight, yet clearly haunted by his past. The tones of his voice superbly echo his regret, sorrow and eagerness to make a mends. The two brothers are fighting a lot more than each other in the arena. They are warriors fighting the cruel cards life has thrown at them. This is a film about second chances and up hill struggles with the potential brutality of life mirrored in the arena. I would strongly recommend this film to anybody and I guess this is my point. The substance of the film is predominantly concerned with stressing universal issues within today's society. Plus, if you just want to see two hours of people fighting each other, you will be far from disappointed by the aggression and brutality found within this winner takes all fighting arena.' I'm sorry Tommy, I'm sorry. Tap Tommy. It's OK. It's OK. I love you. I love you Tommy.'(Brendan to Tommy. Fighting in the cage)

Nick Nolte did a wonderful job, I really felt sorry for him as he tried to collect the pieces of his family back.Honestly, I didn't know Joel Edgerton nor Tom Hardy but they were amazing, they really lived their part, I really liked Tom Hardy's part as a cold emotionless fighter but I was touched when he held Nick Nolte when he was drunk. Review title: An all-American movie for American audiences
Review_body: I've rarely seen so much of America in a feature film, it's going through all the touch points except for the meaningful ones, and most definitely takes shortcuts when it comes to explaining some things, like "We'd love to court-martial you, but we'll let you fight first cAuSe YoU'rE a ReAl AmErIcAn HeRo".

The story is compelling, it is socially apt and the acting is perfect by all....each character of the main ones have their arcs....and you are on the edge of your seat! I hope it wins the Oscar for best ensemble acting....I am afraid that because two of the actors are so buff that some will not appreciate their amazing acting skills throughout this, too.....and it is such a relief to have a feature movie about the working class and not the upper middle class or super riches! Plus, I love the intimacy of the camera....you feel like you are brought so close to the characters so that you can read their nuance, you feel for and love them in all their complexity.. Even though you have to watch some serious bashing in the ring.....('tis why we have eye lids) , the fight scenes are not pulling you into the hurt of it though neither do they escape the physical realities....the sound tracks brings you right into the ring and arena....and they play with the camera work....in varieties of ways to show the story and it is a No BS story. I've seen a few others that had Mid-East Veterans in the story line (Sheridan's the Brothers was one & there is a simplicity and inauthenticity to those (am also thinking of Hurt Locker) or caricatures that are one dimensional) ....this one is complex by not interpreting just sharing the depths and contradictions and it is the best by miles.....no false notes.....despite the preposterousness of the conceit.....my one tiny criticism is that sometimes the back music was a little too crescendo-ish....just a couple of times it pulled you away with its drama....but only for a "bitlet"...They did such interesting work with lens colors' too....darkly tones for the scenes that are emotionally that way....light and bright for others....without being in your face about it.....I really liked!!!! It is so nice to see a GOOOD movie....!!

Review title: Warrior is the Rocky of our generation!
Review_body: We forget about what qualities make an inspiration in todays world. Then we get a movie like Warrior and it all comes back to us. Tom Hardy and Joel Edgerton deliver riveting performances. In saying that you cheer for both brothers through out the movie as Tom Hardy plays Tommy Conlon/Rearden who was a marine that went A-WOL after a mission where he lost the entire squad he belonged too. Tommy on his way out was spotted saving another troop after being stuck inside a tank under water.Joel Edgerton plays Brendan Conlon, The older brother Tommy who is a Physic's teacher and father. (The real underdog in life.) After getting notice that his house was going to be foreclosed and refusing to succumb to bankruptcy, Conlon takes up fighting at night for some extra dough in the parking lot of a strip club. After a night in the lot he returns to school with a students brother seeing him and is suspended without pay from the school. Conlon then strikes up pride and goes to his old trainer where he begins his journey through "Sparta" the 16 man competition where the winner takes home $5 million. The only problem with this plan is that his younger brother Tommy is also in the competition and is seemingly the better fighter and is fighting for his best friends family. His bestfriend was killed during Tommy's last mission in the army.An amazing film! Inspiring, Heart wrenching and the total package when it comes to a family held together by passion! Honorary mention to Nick Nolte who plays the two troubled men's father. Outstanding performance once again.Thanks for reading and please follow on twitter. @realaaronford

Review title: One of the Best Movies of 2011
Review_body: Somehow I missed this movie in 2011. Recently while browsing IMDb Top 250, this movie grabbed my attention. Boy, it was something. This is one of the best movies I've seen in recent times. It holds you from start to end. The punching & fighting scenes are bang on. Star-Cast for the movie has done a great job. Tom Hardy and Joel Edgerton go neck to neck. Where Tom plays an angry-raging character, Joel plays the sensible family fighter. Tom has way less shots in ring as compared to Joel, but they are solid. Jennifer Morrison also justifies to her role and looks appealing & attractive in the movie. For WWE fans, Kurt Angle provides some entertainment with his ring tactics.Direction & Screenplay of Gavior O'Connor stands out in the movie. This surely goes as the biggest movie of his career. This movie deserves to be in Top List of All Time Boxing hits with Rocky Series, Cindrella Man, Million Dollar Baby etc.There is hardly any part of the movie which you feel like skipping and grabbing a beer. If you are watching this, make sure you have all the Beers, Cold Drinks, Nachos, Pop Corns etc. handy before the start. Trust me, you will not feel like breaking the flow.

Thoroughly enjoyed this film, the acting was brilliant from the whole cast, it was raw and heartfelt. Although a predictable end scenario its still a very enjoyable watch. Its been described as a modern day rocky, I would slightly agree, minus the cheese! The training and fight scenes were great and as a BJJ and boxing practitioner I enjoyed watching these bits in the film and it does leave you pumped to go and train! If you buy the DVD there's also some great behind the scenes footage from the film and the story behind the 'tapout' brand. The accents were brilliant from both Tom Hardy (who's British) and Joel Edgerton (oz). Both portrayed convincing American accents. Nick Noltes performance was also brilliant in this. The film also features some known faces from the UFC. All in all I highly recommend watching this. A 10\10 for performances and a 9\10 for the story itself.

This is a truly superb film in every way and so UNDERRATED which was a real shame. Everything in this movie; story, directing, score and acting made this film a classic and must watch film for everyone. It touches your soul with the realistic battles in life and the importance of purpose and belonging. A perfect story to use with teaching students studying relationships and belonging. It was a pleasure to see the outstanding attention to detail in telling this beautiful story. It is unfortunate and confusing as to why there were not more nominations for the acting in this movie. Thank you to all cast and crew for telling this beautiful story and taking us on this journey with you.

This movie is one of my all time favourites. It has a brilliant story line which really gets you into the movie. The fights are fantastic and the ending couldn't of been done better. I take my hat of to the writers and producers of this film, everything from the actors to the music is spot on. If you like UFC and have any spare time at all watch this film. I have watched films like circle of pain and never back down and this movie beats them hands down. It made me smile, laugh and even almost made me cry at the end. The two brother in this film are perfect, they played their part very well and the dad was FANTASTIC. He was the perfect actor for this role because of his previous role's which made the film that much better. I gave it a 10 star rating and will be for a long time one of the best films i have ever seen.

This is the best fighting movie I've seen since Rocky and I'd rank it right up there among the best in the Rocky series (probably Rocky IV). Great story line. Had me squirming in my seat. The ending makes you want more!

This is honestly my all time favorite movie and one of the most underrated movies of all time in my opinion. It just has everything, pain, joy, love, heartbreak, redemption. Just everything you could want this movie has. If you haven't seen this movie yet, I would bump it up to the top of your must see list. Tom Hardy is just incredibly in it, so is Nolte and the whole cast. I consider myself a tough grader and a bit of a hard sell when it comes to movies. usually there are only 3=4 movies a year that I am actually excited to see and even less that I recommend to others. This is my number one movie that I would recommend right now. 10/10 for me, just go see it, that's about all I can say without giving any spoilers.

Review title: It's not just MMA that makes this different.
Review_body: What amazes me most about this film is that it perfectly develops the relationship between Tommy, Brendan and their Father without ever using flashbacks or long exposition sequences explaining why their relationship was where it was. You understand the complexities of their relationship by attaining a few details of the story during each sequence allowing you to slowly piece together the past so you can better understand the present. By doing this, the viewer feels an emotional connection to each character. Part of me cheered for Brendan while feeling like Tommy was unnecessarily cruel to his Father. But then later in the film I became much more sympathetic to Tommy in part because the pieces of history provided throughout the film allowed me to better understand that character. As a result, I was connected to every character in this film making the finale that much more emotional.The fight sequences in this film are some of the best I've ever scene in a movie like this. They feel visceral and rough while also feeling majestic enough to make the professional skill of these fighters believable. The fight choreography and cinematography work together seamlessly to convey a frenetic feeling to the audience while still allowing them to see the fights in all their glory. The little shaky cam that exists works beautifully, and I never felt cheated from the fight scenes as a result.This film is masterful in every sense of the world. There isn't one scene that feels out of place or unnecessary. It's edited in such a lean way often making you forget its two hour and nineteen minute run time.Director Gavin O'Connor is able to sidestep the rudimentary conventions that dominate most boxing movies. It's not just MMA that makes this film feel different from films like Rocky, Southpaw, The Fighter and Cinderella Man. This is an emotional story of two brothers and the pain that they must sift through in order to find true peace. And it's this story that separates it from the rest of the pack and makes it feel fresh and new.Story - 9.5/10 Action - 9.5/10 Cinematography/Score - 9/10 Pacing/Length - 9.5/10 Acting - 10/10Overall Rating - 9.5/10Overall Score - A+
This movie really showcases Tom Hardy's acting talents.

I was really fortunate to watch this movie today. I have heard of this movie but was not a big fan of Tom Hardy but somehow I decided to watch it. I consider this as one of the best sports movie ever made. The film started slow to establish the characters in our mind but second half was really fast. I was crying in last few scenes and I have to really say that the film had its moments. My misconceptions about Tom Hardy got changed and I thoroughly enjoyed watching Nick Nolte,Joel Edgerton and Frank Grillo. MMA fight choreography was really original,some scenes I was so worried by the beating Brendon was receiving during the fight,I forgot that its just a movie. The movie will stay with you for long and has got some great emotional scenes which anyone can relate too which will be rare in sports movies. I recommend this film to all the people who love films..
Tom hardy's bullets are fired in every movie that he is starring in.
Having seen its rating I expected to be entertained. Not so, cause it's simply predictable. What this movie does has been done and done better in other movies like the Rocky films for example.

Review title: I was shocked when I saw this film was rated 8.2
Review_body: I've watched some overrated films and TV shows in my time, but typically when something is rated THIS high, I can feel fairly confident that it won't be terrible. Well, I suppose that isn't the case, because this movie is borderline awful. This is nothing more than a two hour cliché. Every single moment of the film is utterly predictable and completely lacking in creativity. The movie tries so hard to make us feel for these characters, but in the end all I could do was cringe at the cheesiness of it all. I enjoy a film that tugs on the heart strings, and I actually enjoy some cheesiness as long as it's done well, but this film is just poorly written. I still gave it a 5, because it's not unwatchable. The acting is acceptable, and the cinematography is tolerable. My main gripe is with the writing. It's one cliché after another, and with each scene all I can think of is how I'm "supposed" to feel, but nothing was done to actually make me feel that way. I wish people would be more stingy with their 10 star ratings, because this is NOT an 8.2 film, and it would have saved me 140 minutes if people had rated it fairly instead of handing out 10 stars like candy.
I can't explain why, but this movie is a crush for me.

Have never reviewed a film on here but believe this one justifies it To define the film in one word I'd simply say wow !! Brilliant fight scenes, raw emotion, brilliant acting and an edge of your seat film that keeps you hooked all the way through. Being a huge fan of the rocky franchise and with a general love of sport when I first starting watching this I wasn't expecting much. But I was simply blown away. I found myself stood up cheering Brendan on with the hairs on the back of my neck stood on end I'll go as far as to say this is as good as my favourite film of all time, shawshank redemption for the amount of emotion this stirred up in me Wonderfully film that I will never get bored of

Review title: My favorite movie of all time
Review_body: This is not your typical fighting movie. This movie has so much emotion and meaning built into it that it's able to overcome what we're all used to seeing from MMA films and other sport dramas. Tom Hardy, Joel Edgerton and Nick Nolte deliver powerhouse performances that are all deserving of reward recognition. I may be biased because I was involved in martial arts for most of my life so I connect to the sports aspect of the film more than other movies about sports but to me, this movie is something that needs to be watched as there is so much more to this than your typical sports drama. This is now my favorite movie of all time and I hope that you all decide to check it out!

Review title: Read alot of movie reviews and decided to give my own.
Review_body: Theres something about this movie, especially if you are like me and came from a broken home. Every family has problems and their children are there to see them unfold.. This movie captures the aftermath in a way that people can relate to. The final scene is heart wrenching to me each time I watch it and I want to call my brother and tell him I love him. If you have the time to dive into a true masterpiece, this is far more than another fighting movie. Watch it and bring the kleenex for the end.

Review_body: I made an account specificly to warn the developed world. It's only and 8 for AmEriCa NuMbEr OnE-type people. For the rest of us it's mediocre as it's mostly unbelievable cliche's strung together on swelling music. Still okay to watch tho, so a 6.

The Warrior is overdramatic to the point of hilarity. I could see this being a Harmony Korine film about what he imagines what sports masculinity is all about. A ton of laughs! Tom Hardy mumbles and sulks around with terrible posture like a teenager but he's actually a war hero who fights. His brother is a physics teacher who fights and there's some weird side story about his principal and students rooting for him. There's a Russian fighter who is a rip off of Fedor Emelianenko. Great movie, as inspirational as Weekend at Bernie's.

I loved it! The story of family pain relationship heart ache Forgiveness. From the start of the movie I was glued to the screen. Tom hardy is an awesome actor. The whole cast did a great job. The fight choreography was great kudos to the fight and stunt coordinator. More films can take a page out of this book. the blending of the lives tying the stories together and then sealing it all at the end. The only thing I would have loved to see is the teacher give his brother half or some of the money to help out the family of the fallen soldier. Maybe a flash forward in life at the end of the film. maybe during the credits. All in all the film was great.
Every line, every scene. So much heart and depth. Took me off guard as I expected a shallow fighting movie but instead was moved to tears. Same feelings every viewing.

Casting was amazing, Overall great movie. Tom Hardy delivers an excellent acting performance. I had never heard of Tom Hardy before this movie, and I can definitely say that after this, I am a fan... Honestly, this movie is on par with Never Back Down. Never Back Down is one of my favorite fighting movies ever, and this one is definitely up there right along with it. I had never heard of a few of these other actors either, but after this, I would definitely say that I am a fan of all of them. Definitely hoping for a sequel and more movies from this cast. If you haven't seen this yet, GO WATCH IT ASAP. 10/10 Definitely would recommend.

I love a good underdog story. This was so horribly told I'd rather die than watch it again. The wrong brother won, and let's be real. The one that fought the Russian? Should be D E A D. Review title: This is a movie about Redemption, family and complex relationships
Review_body: In all ways this is not a film about MMA. It's really a powerful human and emotional story. It perfectly replicates some of the emotions within families and made me cry at the end.The actors are great and the ending is the best part of the movie. It is the greatest film in the last 10 years and is up there with the shawshank redemption and 12 years a slave on true grit story telling.

Review title: Epic tale of family disintegration, loss and connection
Review_body: The backdrop of UFC provides a perfect expression of the the rage and chaos existing between an violent and abusive father and his now two grown up sons. I found this a masterful and compelling film that I have been drawn back to watch many times. I captures an inspiring tale of men in enormous pain trying to confront and recover from family violence and abuse. The momentum of the characters and the ability of the writers, director and actors to portray the journey of barely restrained rage, rejection, and reconciliation carries the story with powerful momentum. Tom Hardy's depiction of Tommy is truely inspired - his rage seems to be unstoppable - the flashes to his real vulnerability are managed so well. Nick Nolte also delivers a career highlight as the reformed abusive father who cannot change the past. He is trapped in a small world devoid of any real connection trying to confront his past listening to endless loops of Captain Ahab who destroyed everything in his arrogant pursuit of the great White Whale. Joel Edgerton too delivers an exceptional portrayal of the brother who has tried to forget and live a normal life only to find he has unfinished business that must be addressed. He has a younger brother who needs him and cannot forgiveness him for abandoning him all those years ago. What a movie! One of my favourites of all time. Thank you for making this film. It tells my story (minus the UFC)

Review title: Loved the movie, except the ending.
Review_body:
I created a account just to review this movie. I loved this movie until the end, I expected the ending, I knew it was going to end that way but I was still so disappointed.SPOILER ALERT!
You have two brothers, one successful and one not so successful but one hell of a fighter. They portray tom hardy (Tommy) as such a badass, he knocks everyone out with ONE punch! Yet when it came to his older underdog brother he LOSES! The older brother has everything, yes his about to loose his out but he ha: family, as where tommy the younger brother has nothing! And we're supposed to just be happy that he just lost to his school teacher older brother. It made me so angry. Because tommy deserved MUCH BETTER!!

Acting skills may be exceptional. 'Warrior' is more of too many films which continue promoting Testosterone Poisoning. Alcoholics have always been linked with wife-beating. Why taint the sport of Boxing by associating it with alcohol? Ali did quite a lot to bring ethics TO Boxing. Boxing isn't the only sport with the message of Gender-control. Until and unless perspectives of women are provided scenes & scripts central to the camera lens, reality isn't acknowledged. Boxing should always include both genders.

Review title: You saw fight movies before, but not like this one
Review_body: You saw fight movies before, but not like this one. I fell like so many people miss movies like this because it doesn't have a complicated script or huge special effects.It's the story of two brothers of a troubled family , each one with its own respectable motivation for winning a MMA tournament. I don't want to go through much of the story here, what you have to understand is that it flows drama and action in perfectly fluid pace and the scenes are engaging as they slowly deliver a powerful emotional interaction between the characters past and personalities.The moment you allow yourself to connect with each caracter motivation and sink in into the story, you'l experience pure raw emotion coming from this film, the fights serve as a way of magnifying the repressed feelings between everyone involved.Yes, its predictable, but it doesn't take away the beauty and intensity of what happens in each scene. This is just a pure, simple story that draw you raw emotion in every way: anger, sadness, joy, compassion, etc.Enjoy!

Review title: Greatest movie in the history of the world!!
Review_body: I recently viewed this film and i have to admit it was a defining life changing experience!!! Seeing the raw power and emotion of this film reminded me of my time when I used to want to be a cage fighter.The script was immaculate, the story was shocking and the men were cute, what more could you possibly want from a film.This movie was the star of 2011 for me, and the fact it didn't win the Oscar for best picture perplexes and disgusts me. That is what is wrong with Hollywood these days. Even my Tasmanian friend Luke agreed, though this was the first colour film he had seen.10/10 for me, highly recommended boys!! Big Eli

OK i'll try and give a short review on this film as i'm knackered. It deserves more.The characters and plot IMO is much deeper than other films in the genre like "the fighter". The plot seems simpler when you try to define it, but demands more questions.This is a modern day Rocky without unnecessary polar training and the "eye of the tiger" and with a better developed family of characters. At one point i did think the baywatch theme was going to break out before a match but alas it didn't happen and i was left disappointed.The main reason i like this film is that you end with a fight and unlike any other, you don't know who you want to win. I guess this is inevitably the point of the film and the directors do well to balance the favoritism of both main characters. However, I do feel I ended up siding with the older brother only because he had more focus on him and became the underdog, even though i had more sympathy for the circumstances of the younger brother. But then i am a younger brother so maybe biased.Possibly the father's character could have been better defined. What exactly did he do to destroy his family other than being a ballsy drunk? Nick Nolte seems too nice and gained a lot of sympathy. The darker side of his character should have come out more, possibly. His short drunken episode which bonded him and son jr was too minimilised. I would have liked to see some carnage there.Quite a long film but worth the time as you wont look away, especially towards the last 45 mins.

I have never written a review on IMDb, even though I reference this sight at least 5 times a day. I remember seeing the preview for this movie in the theater and knew I wanted to see it. However, it was gone from the theater in a blink. I just watched it on DVD and am simply stunned! This was one of the best movies I have ever seen. In the very beginning it seemed like it was going to be one of those low budget, small town movies that I may end up turning off. 10 minutes in I knew I was wrong. This story takes off and doesn't let up. It has a long running time but in no way drags. The acting between the brothers and father (Nick Nolte!) was just right for the story. By the end I was almost moved to tears (I don't think that has happened since Saving Private Ryan.) For the record, this movie KILLED 'The Fighter' that got so much hype last year. I'm sure lots of people will disagree with me on that one but just watch it for yourself. I will be buying this one on DVD!

Review title: If you need some stereotype in your life go and see Warrior
Review_body: SPOILER: This movie is something new. Everything was so unpredictable, fights, tournament and what an end, totally unexpected, two brothers in the final. What a story!!! Really, I think this film is in top 10, no top 5, worst sport-drama movies in last decade. Do not waste your time. Do not waste your time and money on this film. It is absolute mystery how Warrior reached 8.3 on IMDb. It should be in best case 5, so that people know that they cannot expect any intellectual challenge. So, I guess this is a movie for Ultimate fight fans, because that is the only that it can offer, fight scenes (pumped and not realistic). And believe, this has nothing with a fact that I am a female. I watched Warrior with my brother and husband, both of them shared my opinion. Nothing new, full of stereotypes. OK, I will admit one bright spot. Hotel scene with drunk Nick Nolte character and Tom Hardy character is 3 bright minutes in 140 min of nothing.

Review title: Too pro USA? sponsored by US Army?
Review_body: The movie would be much better if it was less pro USA. I liked the Idea. I love MMA but as an non-American this really spoiled it for me.First of all. You can see the movie is sponsored by the US Army. The army kid who is a hero. In the fight with his bro he looks at the army men in the audience and all sudden gains his strengths again. so cliché.Then again the bad guy is off course the Russian Koba. Hello?! Cold war is over. But the funniest and dumbest thing was that Koba enters the ring with a former Soviet Union flag?!?! The writers must have forgot the Berlin wall has been down since '89 and the Soviet Union doesn't exist.Off course wrestling is the base of both fighters. That didn't surprise me.Another thing. Brazilians rule MMA in the world and especially in the UFC. I haven't seen a Brazilian fighting in the whole movie? If you're an American teenager you'll like the movie. Too bad they didn't think off a broader audience.Have you seen Redbelt (2008)? A BJJ movie. Much better.Greetz.

Let me be clear about one thing first, this is by far the best wrestling movie I've ever seen. This movie has some of the most intimidating and breathtaking fighting scenes that you cant get to watch in real fights. When the fight commentator confirms that 'Tommy Riordan definitely is real', I figured this really hyped up Gavin O'Connor movie Warrior definitely is real. Daron Aronofsky's The Wrestler (2008) was the fighting movie of my mode with more of life, emotions than the fighting, Micky Rourke acted his best in that Oscar nominated movie. Paddy Conlon reminded me of that old fighter re-entering his life with a lot of difficulties. After awhile Tommy and Brendan Conlon and their twisted relationship resembles another two brothers in The Fighter (2010). But none of them mentioned above are worthy to be the epic one, Warrior, I would say has everything to be remembered as the finest wrestling movie ever made.Although there is a lot of cage in this movie but for me, the story is beyond the cage. I have no say about that war hero part, I think everybody knows that the Iraq War is no heroic war to be fought. People of America need to fight a greater war than that. The last fighting scene tells us too much about brotherhood, about family and about Integrity. I saw the scene as a conversation between two brothers who's passed a long time not seeing each other. When you have a brother who's angry as a mad bull, strong as a lion and not realistic at all, you gotta tame that bull down, sometimes in a cage trapped in an even bigger cage of this world. They both won the fight, more precisely the war, together coming out of the cage as warriors.I'm happy that Tom Hardy is the villain in Christopher Nolan's next Batman movie The Dark Knight Rises, because after Heath Ledger set the standard too high doing The Joker in The Dark Knight, I would be really disappointed to see someone any less charismatic and talented as Tom Hardy. He is the iconic beast with strong instincts and superficial fighting style but unfortunately a very mentally twisted and lonely fighter here. Joel Edgerton, on the other hand a high school Physics teacher trying to get the money for his family. Eventually both of their egos and clashes fall apart in the ring and all that remains is a pure classy drama of brotherhood. Extremely glorious performances from every major character.The movie is tight enough to make you not to do anything during the playtime, dialogues are few in quantity but full of wisdom and quality. About the soundtrack, beside all the well suited sounds in the fights, the last song I believe is a post rock explosive which burst out with joy and glory at the end, nothing could be more appropriate than that. Overall, very good time watching this cult masterpiece. This is the story of the fight of our time.

This movie is fascinating.You will be in complete shock after this movie.Story is full of emotions and you don't have to be ashamed if you let a few tears after this movie.Great performances by actors especially Nick Nolte as a father of two sons,Tom Hardy is incredible in his role certainly the best role of his career,Joel Edgerton is also very good.All three actors put up some of the most convincing performances in their career.The Fighter is a good movie,Oscar nominated movie but Warrior is ten times better than The Fighter.Father Paddy (Nick Nolte) is former alcoholic who is trying to reach out for his sons for forgiveness of being a family wreck.His older son former Marine Tommy Conlon (Tom Hardy) is a war hero who is suffering through PTSD decide that he wants to fight in Sparta and give the prize money to a wife of his fallen friend Manny.Younger son Brendan Conlon (Joel Edgerton) is a former MMA fighter,now a Physics teacher who faces financial problems with his house and is slowly getting back into the mix by competing in underground fights. But the education system finds out about his underground fights and he is suspended without pay,so he uses this to train full time, and compete in Sparta.The movie had a specific way to get emotionally attached to characters and to know them really good.This movie is a truly respectable candidate for the Academy Award.My advice is that you leave anything you doing and run to the cinema,you wont regret it.This movie will be carved in your memory because of his incredible emotional story and incredible roles of actors especially Tom Hardy,Nick Nolte and Joel Edgerton.Once again i have to say it is truly amazing movie!!!

Review title: I can't believe it! 8.2/10 for a movie like this?!
Review_body: Last night, my friends and I got together to watch a movie. We chose "Warrior 2011" because of its high IMDb rating. Was that a mistake? Absolutely YES!GOD! You cannot believe how boring a movie can be. A typical rocky-style story. Everyone can guess what will happen, from the beginning to the end. Watching the movie, we were looking forward something to put the story out of its misery, maybe a better acting or at least a different ending. Surprisingly, nothing special happened! Only a miracle could save the movie. What a waste of time. Did we feel amused? NO! Did we learned something new? NO! Do we recommend it to others? NO! I don't know how it could gain such a high rating.Whatever you do, stay away from "Warrior"!

A good movie ruined by such a dumb ending that it's actually offensive to the intellect.The movie its self was very well executed and well done and the build up to the final showdown was very carefully crafted. I have to say that i really liked the movie(excluding the ending). I thought Tom Hardy and Nick Nolte both gave a very effective performance and the movie dealt with some very heavy emotions and connected with the audience fairly well. How ever the movie does get a bit "over the top" in some cases but that aside i have to say that the movie was pretty exciting to watch and be invested in emotionally. My recommendations: I would like to recommend this movie how ever the ending did really ruin the entire experience for me so don't watch the final fight scene that the whole movie has built up to.(if you can).

Eight months into the year and this is easily the best film of 2011 thus far and a sure Oscar contender. Saw an advanced screening at the Landmark in L.A. and haven't seen a reaction like that from an audience in a very long time. Cheering. People crying coming out of the theater. Very blown away. The performances are across-the-board phenomenal. Tom Hardy and Joel Edgerton give movie star turns and should be nominated for Best Actor, and Nick Nolte hasn't been this good since AFFLICTION and should win Best Supporting. He's the best American actor never to win an Oscar and that should change this winter. Edge of your seat excitement, raw emotion, humor--WARRIOR does everything. Expectations weren't high going in (the trailer is very pedestrian and makes it look like a genre sports movie, which it isn't), but I was completely floored and wiped out by the end (a song by The National plays over the film's final scene and if it doesn't make you cry you're tougher than I am). Hats off to director Gavin O'Connor for this one. Not only is it better than THE FIGHTER, but it's on par with ROCKY and RAGING BULL and is something of a combination of the former's spiritedness and the latter's grittiness. Incredible movie.

Review title: Not the movie I expected, but much better for it
Review_body: If you are looking for a fight you'll get it. You'll also get a lot more. This was the first movie I have EVER shed a tear in. Gripping and powerful. Even though the trailer made it clear how each fight was going to end I was still on the edge of my seat.The family dynamic was heart wrenching. Nick Nolte's performance as a lonely old man grasping for a hint of forgiveness from his family is Oscar-worthy. The roles of the two brothers were pretty archetypal (tough guy fights for honor, peaceful guy puts gloves back on to fight for family) but were played well, and the family relations make up for the lack of originality.

Review title: 1st time a movie made me cry
Review_body: I am reviewing first time only because this movie is one of the best emotional, fighting movie ever. This is a silly film. Too many non believable plot turns. Acting was fine, but kind of forced and dramatic for the sake of being dramatic. It feels more like a made for TV movie than something made in 2011 for the big screen that we're supposed to take seriously.

Review title: A different interpretation of the ending.
Review_body: Please don't read this if you don't want the ending given away.I've noticed a lot of people complaining that the ending spoils the film and is clichéd because the underdog and not the better fighter wins.I'm not suggesting that my interpretation is the right one but my view is somewhat different than the one some people hold. It is perfectly logical to point out that Brendan had hard fights to get to the final and that he would probably have been exhausted and that Tommy has had a much easier route.However, the point is that he made that route easier because of his rage. Tommy is only the more destructive force because of that. His demons are driving him on because he is lost. He cannot or will not reach out to connect with his father or brother. The point is that the dam is broken when he sees his father in the hotel room raging against Ahab. This is deeply symbolic. I think you are meant to draw the connection with Ahab who was driven by his own rage with the rage of the father which destroyed his family to the rage which Tommy now feels. Even though he is drunk it is no coincidence that his father refers to Tommy as Ahab and bellows at him to stop the ship. At the point that Tommy takes him in his arms and holds him he begins the healing process but loses what makes him such a formidable fighter. Thus he is simply unable to blow his brother away in the way that he has done to every other opponent.The other crucial point (and you would have to be a younger brother to fully get this one) is that Tommy doesn't really want to beat his brother at that point. He needs to know that his brother loves him and perhaps that he regrets not reaching out to him when they were younger. The fact that he taps out only at the point when Brendan says he loves him is significant as is the fact that he breaks down in the corner before the final round. Had he still been carrying his rage he would surely rather have been rendered unconscious than submit.In other words, for me it was the perfect ending and the more you think about the film the more profound it seems.All in my view of course. Which could be a load of old rubbish.

Warrior gets a 10 for one reason: it's the only movie I've seen in the past decade that is completely devoid of Hollywood cliché.When the separate brothers interact with their father for the first time? No forgiveness or feel good pat-you-on-the-back tear moment. When the one brother tells his wife about the big fight, no "Oh honey I'll be watching you earnestly and will cry and cheer when you are victorious" cliché. When the brothers interact for the first time, no 'family and brotherhood is more important than all the gold in the kingdom' B.S. Just tried and true emotion and real people from real backgrounds.This is just four examples that set this movie apart. The real reason you have to watch this movie is to remember what the experience of watching movies is actually about. It's NOT to cry over a clichéd ending or have an "oh duh" moment over something you saw coming a mile away. It's seeing real characters, in a real tortured scenario, living and being the way they've known and been raised in a way that is completely separated from modern cinema. So, no, it's not about beating people up. Please just watch it and thank all the 10 star reviewers later.

Review title: One of the best movies of the last decade
Review_body: The summary says it all and seriously its one the most emotional and powerful movies i have seen in a long time. The acting by the one and only Nick Nolte as well as the two on-screen brothers Tom Hardy and Joel Edgerton is exceptional and simply "feels real". The mix of a broken family with MMA and the struggles of each member to get on with their lives in anyway possible is perfect. With me being a huge fan of UFC and MMA in general i can say that, as far as the fights are concerned, they look completely realistic. I must admit that a was almost moved to tears by that movie, something that, to be honest, has happened to me once or twice in the past. I am trying to see if there are any flaws, but don't seem to find any! I recommend it to everyone, despite their movie taste.

Review title: Wasn't expecting it to be good.
Review_body: I wanted to see this movie purely because I am a Tom Hardy fan. I normally hate movies like this and therefore I wasn't expecting it to be good. If there was a way i could justify this movie in one word...it has to be "Balance". Yes its your usual rigmarole of a martial art action movie and it does come with its predictable set of events...however what this film also does is takes you to "Rocky"...and then to "Wrestler". And then carves a niche for itself with its brilliant performances and human connect.What i really liked about the film was the camera work...it teleports you wonderfully closer to the actors making you feel you are a part of that moment living with them! Fight sequences were brilliantly choreographed. what else can i say... definitely a better film for me than the "Fighter"...Will watch it again and again! may be!

Movie is loosely related to the Parable of the prodigal son,set in a modern everyday American setting.This movie is seen from the eyes of the two brothers.Both needed forgiveness and love.The "brotherhood" of belonging to the navy or army can never replace the true bond of a family. Even though the younger brother spurned the forgiveness of the elder brother but eventually that was what he was really seeking.His pride and anger prevented him from talking the problem out with his brother.He best expressed his challenges in the 'ring'.The 'art of fighting' was a gift given to the two sons by their father.It is in the 'ring' they will find redemption and love,which we all long for. Now will the elder brother spurn the love and forgive his father? On the whole a great movie

I am in absolute chock....I did not know what to expect from this movie but it rendered me completely speechless. Review title: One of the best movies of 2011
Review_body: If you like Sports Drama Genre, this is the best of best... Tom Hardy was spectacular in this movie. Story was pretty amazing narrated too. If you really liked Million Dollar Baby, this is the next level of heartbreaking and emotionally satisfied s**t.Haunted by a tragic past, ex-Marine Tommy Conlon (Hardy) returns home for the first time in fourteen years to enlist the help of his father (Nick Nolte) to train for SPARTA, the biggest winner-takes- all event in mixed martial arts history. A former wrestling prodigy, Tommy blazes a path toward the championship while his brother, Brendan (Edgerton), an ex-fighter-turned teacher, returns to the ring in a desperate bid to save his family from financial ruin. But when Brendan's unlikely, underdog rise sets him on a collision course with the unstoppable Tommy, the two brothers must finally confront each other and the forces that pulled them apart, facing off in the most soaring, soul stirring, and unforgettable climax that must be seen to be believed.

This is a formula movie which makes no sense at all and merely sets up conditions that will supposedly tug at your heart strings. It's difficult to give the reasons for my conclusion without putting in a spoiler. The plot is thin, the characters unbelievable and the ending is absolutely ridiculous.True, we enjoy movies as a way to escape reality for a little while but how so much money can be spent making a movie as bad as this is beyond any logical thought. I suppose if you are a teenager and like flash bang violence without any thought to reality then this would be the movie to see. Afterwards you can go beat up some grade school children and buy a trophy for your efforts.

This movie is outstanding!!! To me Oscar worthy!!! My god, I wasn't expecting such a great movie. this one is awesome, fool of passion, courage, revenge, anger. Good script and really well directed and written by Gavin O'Connor! And it's not all about fighting, believe me. In the end...the fight was won by LOVE and Family, not by a man!And we can't just forget the good performances by Joel Edgerton, Tom Hardy, Frank Grillo and of course Nick Nolte. To me Tom Hardy did a tremendous job, as a kid that had been through a lot a bad things in his life. But in the end we gets, not what he wanted but what he needed. Nick Nolte as usually was outstanding, to me Oscar worthy. Frank Grillo prove himself in this movie, I used to love him in "The gates", but in this movie he shows a lot a personality and that he is one of the best actors of our time, because I think sometimes he's a lot underestimated!To me this movie deserved at least an Oscar nomination it's way better than most of the movies of 2011!

Review title: Surprised to discover one of my Favorite movies this year!
Review_body: I really had no intention of seeing this movie based on the trailer, but since we seem to be in a dry spell right now with no new big or must-see movies out there and because I saw that other people were giving this movie such high marks, I decided I should give it a shot.I was completely and pleasantly surprised at just how awesome this movie was. I am not into MMA or really any type of fighting/boxing at all in the real world, but you'll find that won't affect your enjoyment of this movie because the heart of this movie is about family and personal set-backs and overcoming obstacles and issues. There's no one out there who can't find someone/something to relate to in this movie.The story starts out at a slower pace and begins to build and build until the end - very cleverly crafted. I found myself actually reacting out loud in the theater to some of the fight scenes at the end, and as I said, I don't even really like MMA. But you really care for these characters and that's what makes the movie so engaging.The only other movie I've seen this year I'd put on the same level as this one is The Help. Warrior should at the very least get an Oscar Nomination for Original Screenplay with possibly a couple of actor nominees and best direction/picture nominees as well.Not much else to say except go see it for sure! I laughed. I cried. I grimaced. I cheered. If a movie can evoke that kind of emotion, what else can you ask for?!?

I don't like the fighting movies but a friend of mine said that it's not just about fighting, it is a touchy story and a great movie. I just watched it and i felt "obligated" to let other people know what a great movie it is!I really loved the way story got explained. After i watched the movie i suggested the movie to a lot of people cause i knew they are gonna love it too!This is a Must See movie, grab popcorn, get a friend or someone else and go watch this amazing movie! The actors and actress were amazing too.

Review title: A Final Act with a Powerful Punch
Review_body: Some of the best fighting scenes I've seen in a movie. As I watched, I found myself flinching with every blow, wriggling around in my seat delightfully enraptured during these truly epic scenes. They are by far the best part of the film, and that's saying a lot. All the actors are outstanding and the emotional build-up at the end is so fantastic and gripping, that it's hard to put into words. Granted, the first half is very slow and a little cliché. Once you get to the halfway point the movie SKYROCKETS. By the beautiful, heart-wrenching, touching, action- packed, magnificent, and overall EXHILARATING, final act, you'll have forgotten all that might have been possibly slow from the beginning, for you will be truly captivated. The final minutes will make you want to weep and cheer all at the same time. I've never seen such a huge take off in a movie as this one, for the second half is just plain brilliant. Tom Hardy is a machine in this movie, a ball of tightly wounded rage and hurt that his opponents unfortunately feel as he viciously unleashes it ALL in the ring. While his brother, Joel Edgerton, is more stable, still dealing with his own heavy problems as well, but like his fighting style, is thoughtful and deliberate in his decisions. I'm tempted to say these brothers make up your protagonist and antagonist, but then I would be sorely mistaken. You have your clear-cut hero, Edgerton the good-hearted school teacher trying to save his family and home due to financial troubles, and your ANTI-hero (most of the time my favorite characters in movies) Hardy, the dark, complex, and untrusting war "hero" that cannot let go of his tragic past from both war and his earlier home life. Both these actors carry the film, both equally engrossing, and their inevitable confrontation at the end is powerful, brutal, and breathtaking. Nick Nolte is especially engaging, playing the formerly severe alcoholic father begging for redemption from his two sons. (I sense a possible Oscar nomination for him) Overall, this movie is brutal while thoroughly uplifting and touching at the same time, and it is speckled with some surprisingly humorous moments. It creates quite a build up, and the ending trumps and exceeds all possible expectations. The fight scenes are BEAUTIFULLY choreographed and are, once again, some of the best fight scenes I've seen in a movie. If your not an MMA fan you will become one after this movie. If you are an MMA fan, you will lose your mind with delight during this movie. Overall, the first half may be hard to stay with, but the movie eventually transcends into a gripping, emotional, heart-racing, and brilliant tale of two brothers with stakes higher than you can imagine. This one will have you on the edge of your seat, whilst you hold back tears. Warrior is a must see.On one quick different note, if Tom Hardy's Bane is anything like he is in this movie, then Batman is sure in for a beating, because he is a MONSTER in Warrior. I cannot wait to see Hardy in The Dark Knight Rises for he has proved to be intriguing and captivating, while equally terrifying in Warrior. Seems like a great fit to me. :)

Review title: AWESOME!!! in every sense of the word.
Review_body: To begin with, i had this movie for about a month before and i really didn't expect much from it other than the usual action packed fight scenes kinda movie but i got bored 1 day and not having anything to do, i decided to watch it after all and boy was i in for a pleasant surprise. this movie literally blew my mind.It was excellent in every sense. the acting was on point with all the main characters and everyone involved in this movie. the dramatic aspect of it also took me by surprise when i found myself on the verge of tears a couple of times through out the movie. the story was very well thought out and explaining everything without flaws as the movie unfolds and some of the dialogue were just brilliant to say the least.I must say some of my favorite moments though were the commentary during the fight scenes...very clever wise cracks there by the commentators.This movie just made it into my top 5 movies of all time if not top 3.I recommend this movie for anyone that simply appreciates good movies.AWESOME!!!!!!!!!!!

It is by far one of the best films I have ever watched and would extremely recommend it to anyone! I instantly thought I wouldn't like it as i'm not into movies similar to 'Rocky' but was amazed. I found the movie emotional at times and was at the edge of my chair with excitement.Unlike most movies these days I didn't find it predictable therefore it made me more surprised and wanting to know what was going to happen next. I thought the plot was original/great as it seemed very realistic and believable. The actors were brilliant and it wouldn't have been the same without both the brothers.

Gripping, emotional... These two adjectives comes to my mind after watching 'Warrior'. It has been a while since I wanted to jump in the air during watching a film, and I am not overreacting now. When I first watched the trailer, I thought 'yet another predictable fighting movie...' What a great surprise it was for me. Story is about two men, brothers as we find out. Brendan and Tommy have not seen each other in a long time, and very deep tension, anger can be sensed when we see them both meet. They have their problems. Brendan is closed to losing his home, where he lives with his wife and three little daughters and Tommy promised his close to heart friend while fighting in the war to take care of his family. I do not want to get into details, so I will just skip to the part which is important - they end up in the MMA tournament, called Sparta, with the main prize of 5.000.000 $.As opposed to other fighting type movies, where we see this bad dude, and a really good man, victim usually, this one is different. To the last moment we do not know who is really going to win, because they are both good, they both deserve to win the money. We see them struggling not only as opponents but also as brothers. They are hurt, have regrets.This is why I really enjoyed this movie. Because it makes you feel the emotions.I think it has been ages since I gave a film 10 out of 10 in rating, and I am happy to do it, especially that this film deserves a lot of credit.Thank you for taking your time. Enjoy :)10/10

First of all I would like to say that I am not a fan of sports or fighting movies in the first place. Rocky did not interest me as that it just not my type of film and I have to say that I was reluctant to go and view this movie BUT.... I was extremely and pleasantly surprised whilst I was exiting the cinema after seeing this film. This movie is not just a movie for hardcore UFC fans but it is a movie for anyone who enjoys films altogether. The fight scenes that take place throughout this movie are brilliantly choreographed and they will take your breath away. The plot line is very well directed and the cinematography is outstanding in some instances |e.g the montaged training scene|. The actors did fantastic in their roles but I would have loved to see more of Nick Nolte.In conclusion. This movie was amazing from start to finish and will leave you wanting more when the credits start to roll. 10/10.

Review title: Is this supposed to be good ?
Review_body: This is my first review on IMDb,in fact I specially sighed up here to give a comment and vote cos until now I trusted the score system on the movies here...8.3 and 55K votes for this movie!?!Maybe its only me but this film doesn't deserve that score, I've seen lots of movies but this is far from a 8,3....I mean please it has all the clichés of the American bull- crap(I am not saying that everything American is bull crap)but this film has most of them,very cleverly hidden behind a story that keeps you hoping it wouldn't be the same bull crap American cliché.Maybe this is a good indicator how retarded the world is becoming.If there wasn't so much hype around this film I would've give in it a higher score ,but sadly my first vote on IMDb which I respect,had to be 1(awful)star.

I don't often write reviews, but on this occasion I felt I must for the simple reason this movie really moved me. It's more than just a fighting movie. It's a movie of life. A broken home, a war vet, a family struggling to get by. A good.... no... fantastic all-round movie. Basically the story goes two brothers, one, the war vet, the other a teacher, not able to pay the bills and look after his family the way he wants to, compete in a mma contest. (That's mixed-martial-arts for those of you who don't know.) Yes it may be an obvious outcome, the brothers have to fight each other in the end. But the movie has so many more levels to it than that. All of the leading actors, Joel Edgerton, Nick Nolte, and of course Tom Hardy are all really on-form. Good to see Nick Nolte back on top after an unfortunate couple of years, and that may be why his performance is so good because he can relate to this in real life as he plays a troubled alcoholic. But for me Tom Hardy steals the show. This is an actor who is really on fire just now. It doesn't seem to matter what part he plays, whether it be a prisoner in Bronson (again a fantastic performance) or an mma/war vet he plays it like the part what made for him. He plays this part perfectly and I don't think there is a single actor at the moment who could have played the part better. Go see this. You will not be disappointed.

I would recommend this movie to anyone.You do not need to be a fan of mixed martial arts to enjoy this thrilling and emotional picture. Although it may help its ratings if you are. Anyone who has endured the emotional confusion of a torn family life will relate to at least one of these characters in some way I'm sure.Excellent story, casting, fight/action scenes and soundtrack. An all rounder this one people.I rate this movie at 10 out of 10 because I truly believe it deserves a 9.5, and I'm a "glass half full" kind of person.Watch it! It's awesome!

Review title: Arnie, Sty, Chuck move over!! its all about Tom Hardy now!
Review_body: This film is by far the best fighter/drama in 20odd years, and as a MASSIVE fan of Rocky IV, Warrior is a far superior film. Why? because not only are the fight scenes realistic, the acting is simply brilliant.Tom Hardy who I've been a fan of since RockNrolla is rapidly becoming an action hero of the modern era, Move aside Arnie, chuck and sty (I still love all there movies!!! apart from rocky V that was shocking) this guy isn't just muscle bound, he can actually act, something the likes of the names I mentioned wasn't very strong at, this film a cracker and wont be deemed cheesy in the future. the plot is simple and elegant, I only had one flaw with this film and its nothing that most would even think about.If you like a good drama, watch this film!! if you love M.M.A like me, watch this film!! if you want to see a film that you can believe would happen, watch this film, I think everyone should see this because what ever you are into, this film is an absolute master piece

Review title: Best Sports Movie this year. One of the greatest fighting movie of all time
Review_body: Over the past few years we've been receiving quite a lump sum of MMA movies due to the rise of the sport. But movies like Never back down, and fighting just doesn't cut it with their cliché man against man rivalry, with their over the top inaccurate MMA-like action. Then there came Warrior. Was it just another MMA movie with over the top hardcore action? Well lets find out.What pulled me into the movie at first was the trailer. The trailer didn't have hardcore rock or scenes of "You're not the best around here you can't beat me" shenanigans. It had the sense of two brothers trying to solve their own problems while trying to deal with each other and their former alcoholic father through the use of a huge MMA tournament named Sparta. In which revealed in the trailer they eventually have to face each other.The story of Warrior although is very MMA suited, you will see about more drama than there is action. Not that there is a problem with that, but it's always great to see how everything unfolds. A former MMA fighter now Physics teacher Brendan Conlon (Joel Edgerton) faces financial problems with his house and is slowly getting back into the mix by competing in underground fights. But the education system finds out about his antics, thus for he is suspended without pay. So he uses this to train full time, and compete in Sparta. Whereas former Marine Tommy Conlon (Tom Hardy) a war hero who is suffering through PTSD, decides he wants to fight in Sparta to give the prize money to the family of his fallen friend. Then there is the father Paddy (Nick Nolte) a former alcoholic who is trying to reach out for his sons for forgiveness of being a family wreck. Who in return is being used as Tommy's trainer, bet is being neglected by him as well. Then Brendan although neglecting him as well, is trying to deal with his own problems and has no time for him.As for the fight scenes of the movie, I can say I am an experienced Martial artist I've trained in several styles. Although I am not a pro MMA fighter yet, I've watched enough fights to actually comprehend how MMA fights are like and the rules and whatnot. Warrior has put in really great choreography of an authentic MMA fight. It was as if I was watching real fights on the big screen. Although there were some over the top moves here and there, most of the techniques portrayed in Warrior are applicable in a real life combat situation.The performance and screenplay, all were simply amazing. Tom Hardy's performance was astounding, as so was Nick Nolte's. The appearances of Nate Marquardt (UFC), Anthony Johnson(UFC), Erik Apple(Strikeforce), Roan Carneiro(Freelance) and Kurt Angle(TNA) did a really good job being actors of the movie while being able to retain their athletic ability of being professional athletes in combat sports.The movie had a unique way making you feel absorbed into the movie, getting to know the characters and feeling attached to them emotionally. Warrior is an emotional roller coaster that will make you laugh, really tense, and even leaving the theater in tears. Whether you are the MMA athlete, fan, trainer, enthusiast or an average movie goer, This movie is for you. Definitely one of the best movies I've seen this year.

Review title: One of the most intense movies ever ....
Review_body: I am not a fan of MMA but I am sure that its history is much less than WWE. While a lot of people watch and follow WWE just because of its story lines and "acts", MMA fans usually watch MMA fights for real fights. Fights are real and the outcome at times could be between life or death. The intensity behind and beneath its fights should be portrayed much more than WWE matches. Warrior delivers the intensity up to the maximum level it possibly can. I do think fight scenes are good enough. Obviously if you haven't watched MMA in your whole life, you need to be with someone that at least can tell you the rules. I was with my wife and she is definitely no fan of MMA, boxing, WWE, etc...and I explained to her the difference between MMA, WWE and Boxing. The acts are great. I will be shocked if I don't see some Oscar nomination. One of the story lines is everyday - unfortunately for these days - life of many of us. The other story line at least from my point of view needed more information. It was good to see both sides of a human being in his life however the story doesn't give you time to feel close to the character,when he does something heroic and when he runs away. When I saw that Warrior came out 3d in box office, I thought people might be biased toward a movie about MMA - and many may say wth is MMA - so I decided to get the review out. Once again it's an INTENSE movie so if you are on a date and looking for a romantic movie definitely it's not recommended but if you want to see why and how some people go to the CAGE to FIGHT for a GOAL, this is definitely a movie to watch.
